author: {'steamid': '76561198869048507', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 123, 'playtime_at_review': 2273, 'last_played': 1712278857}
review:
Battle Of Empires 1914-1918 Is A Surprisingly Good Game That Can Hold Up Decently Even In 2024. It Isn't Perfect, As Nothing Is, But It's Quite Good. Battle of Empires 1914-1918 Plays Very Differently Compared To The More Well Known Game Running On The Same Engine, Men Of War: Assault Squad/Men Of War: Assault Squad 2. I Will Be Using Men Of War: Assault Squad 2 As A Base To Compare. (Note That I Have Only Really Played The Campaigns So Multiplayer Knowledge Is Limited To Solo Testing)
Gameplay: Battle Of Empires 1914-1918 Plays Much Differently Then Men Of War, With A Larger Focus On Artillery Over Vehicles. Defense Is Much Easier Due To Cheap Artillery And Tanks, While Much Harder To Access And Use Well, Do Much Better Due To The Lack Of Quick, Mobile AT (Aside From AT Rifles).
Gameplay, Infantry: Infantry Seem To Be Much Squishier In This Game Compared To Men Of War, Which Makes Cover That Much More Important. However, Infantry Are Also Much More Effective Due To The Fact That Automatic Weaponry Is Much More Limited (Handheld LMGs, MMGs And Tank MGs). Infantry Never Really Fall Off, Due To The Limits Of How Fast You Can Get Tanks. [TLDR: Infantry Are Much Better In This Game Due To The Lack Of Easy-To-Get Automatic Weapons, But Also Get Killed Much Faster]
Gameplay, Tanks: Tanks Are MUCH More Valuable In Battle Of Empires Due To Their Cost And Power. One Tank Used Right Can Turn The Tide Of The Battle. Despite The Lack of Variety, Tanks Are The Powerhouses, And Losing Even One Can Effect The Whole Game. Due To The Much Lower Speed Of Tanks And The Focus On Powerful Artillery Means It Can Be VERY Hard To Use Tanks, But Use Them Right And They Can Win You The Game. Most Tanks Are Much Better On Defense, Such As The International. Very Few Tanks Perform Better On Offence Then Defense, One Of These Being A7V. One Of The Main Factors In Tank Warfare Is Speed: They All Move At Basically The Same Speed. [TLDR: Tanks Are Alot Better But Also Worse, Much Stronger But Much More Vulnerable. Most Tanks Are Focused On Defense]
Gameplay, Artillery: Artillery Is The Most Powerful Asset On The Field, The Basic Artillery Is Unlocked Fairly Early On In Multiplayer Battles And Is A Game-Changer. Tanks In Range Can Simply Be Pelted From Afar Due To Their Low Speed. And The Bigger Artillery Make Light Work Of Almost Everything. Artillery Do Have A Few Weaknesses, Their Range Is Much Lower Then Men Of War's Artillery, Which Allows The Much Faster Infantry Or Horse Mounted Infantry To Rush Through, Alongside This Is Their Low Speed. Men Of War Artillery Can Be Towed Just Like This Game, However Their Towing Vehicles Are Much Faster. Battle Of Empire's Towing Vehicles Are Only A Bit Faster Then The Tanks, So Artillery Can't Exactly Move Very Fast. [TLDR: Artillery Dominates, But Has Big Weaknesses]
Extra Things, Infantry: Infantry VS Infantry Battles Can Last A Long Time Due To The Only Real Weapon Being Rifles, Which Have Cooldowns Between Each Shot.
Extra Things, Tanks: Tanks With Multiple Turrets Are VERY Well Done, Each Weapon Can Fire On It's Own And Are Quite Accurate.
Extra Things, Artillery: Artillery Can Be Easily Hidden If Needed Behind Walls And The Such.
Extra Things, Factions: Every Ingame Faction Has A Good Variety Of Infantry, Tanks And Artillery. However, Germany, Britain And France Have A Few Extra In Terms Of Infantry Selection.

Overall: Overall Battle Of Empires: 1914-1918 Is A Good Buy, The Unique Gameplay Of WWI Is Quite Fun And Can Get Quite Hectic At Times. Sadly, The Multiplayer Is Basically Dead And If You Want To Play It With Other People, You Either Need To Get Some Friends To Buy The Game Or Find An Online Community. 100% Would Recommend Buying The Game + DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355934665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3953, 'last_played': 1691867647}
review: Aunque me gustan los juegos al estilo Men of War y tematicas historicas o belicas en general, creo que no puedo recomendar un juego en estas condiciones, se siente como un mod de pago mas que otra cosa con muchos desperfectos, animaciones rotas, como la de los caballos que se mueven sin mover sus patas,imagenes de perfil de unidades desaparecidas y vacias, gore absurdo y me atreveria a decir degradado comparado a los Men of War originales, tanques dificiles de controlar y no presisamente por rigor historico sino porque controlarlos de forma individual o en grupo se siente casi imposible de dirigir o lo ironico, un tanque que pasa sobre una trinchera o una pila de escombros se queda bloqueado ante un grupo de sacos o ataudes indestructibles en el suelo. Hay misiones interesantes y algun detalle currado, como el ver como agonizan los soldados heridos de muerte en el piso y algunos sacan una pistola para dar sus ultimos disparos desesperados hacia el enemigo. Pero por lo demas no es recomendado lo que vale este juego con todas sus campa√±as y DLC por separado, comprad si os interesa igualmente en rebajas o juegos del tipo Indie que si lo valen como Gates of Hell, Regiments, o Ancestors Legacy o simplemente buscad un mod de la WW1 en el workshop de los Men of War y otros juegos por el estilo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960940977', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1682731398}
review:
Too confusing.

The tutorial doesn't explain the controls (or mechanics) adequately, which is a disaster as the controls are a total mess and the UI has 40 buttons. The missions are linear which stifles room for creativity in your strategy (pointless invisible walls often block the flanks). The gameplay mechanics are awkward as you find everything out the hard way, like the behaviour of the units (which are utterly brainless). The objectives seem stupid, partly because they're not explained in any detail.

The DLC looks like a mess. The voice acting is out of place, and the music is basic. There's forced cutscenes. The loading screen quotes appear to be an awkward mixture of real and fictional quotes. The animations and effects are crude, and the graphics are dated. If they wanted to add detail (like forcing micromanagement), it needed to be done with quality, but there's a clear lack of quality throughout the game. There's RTS games out there that play infinitely better than this.

Why would I recommend a game to friends if so much of it was confusing and it barely explains anything? I like the idea of bringing an important part of history to life through the RTS genre, but it feels like the soldiers just die because of janky mechanics. You'd need buckets of patience to trudge through this, and I'm not convinced it's worth it. It feels like a mod, and not a particularly good one. The DLC alone is ¬£30.72 - I don't think the game has that kind of value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023023915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 2451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2093, 'last_played': 1653697931}
review:
Buy with caution and only in sale

The game can be fun at times but in general the experience feels tedious.

This game is only recommended for those with prior experience in Men of War games.

It has an strange DLC Policy, the justification was supposedly to allow users to buy only what they want, something that makes no sense because if you are interested only in single player you are forced to buy the multiplayer base game, or at least that was the case when I purchased the game.

There is a lot of single player content, seven campaigns with 51 missions: Russia, France, Britain, Germany, Austria-Hungary, Turkey and the Blazing Guns campaign.

Unfortunately, the mission design feels subpar compared to all the other Men of War games.

The ninth mission of the russian campaign is bugged.

The second mission of the Austria-Hungary is bugged. 

For some reason at least 4 stealth/infiltration sections were included in the  Blazing Guns campaign, why include stealth missions in a tank campaign? 

Some objectives are poorly designed for example in one of the Ottoman missions you have to repel an attack, however the objective is only completed when you kill all the enemies even whey they already ceased the attack. 

The french campaign is good, the ottoman campaign is just average and the russian campaign feels boring even when this campaign was in theory the one focused in narrative.

Maybe the problem was to make so many missions, this game contains almost the double of single player missions compared to other Men of War Games. Maybe it would have been better to create less but better missions in a single player core and only later to develop DLC campaigns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067550454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1664922056}
review:
I for the life of me can't understand why this game has so many negative reviews, because it's quite literally Men of War Assault Squad 1/2 with the old school MoW control scheme with a WW1 setting. Sure, the level of polish isn't quite on par with MoW with various grammatical errors (you can really tell the guy who wrote the script isn't a native English speaker, which is made all the more bizarre considering it's voice acted dialogue most of the time so I don't know why the clearly British VA's didn't just correct it themselves?) and some bits of bugs here and there, but there's nothing glaring that I've noticed thus far.

I got to take part in the Battle of Cambrai in a video game, which is pretty dope. I went from commanding a small squad of Mk. IV British tanks and punching through the German lines having to take small hard fought gain after small hard fought gain, to losing one of the female tanks and having another break down, to a daring tool grab from the crew of the broken down tank as the command tank flanked the German artillery and laid down suppressing fire, to regrouping with both tanks for one final push through the lines as the female tank was finally lost for good and the command tank barely makes it through the final push after finishing off the German guns and supporting the infantry push. 

Then we come to a halt as our tank is broken down and I have to equip my crew with scavenged battlefield German weapons and stage a raid on a German camp to get tools to fix our treads as a lone courageous soldier braves MG and artillery fire to siphon fuel from a fallen Allied herm. Mk. IV left on the shell scarred roads at the other side of the map.. all for it to come together with us refueling and repairing the tank, pushing through the last of the lines into a small German village where we regroup with another tank platoon and engage in tank on tank battles with a small platoon of German A7V's supported by field artillery and infantry. We finally take the village and finish the campaign, many a reloaded save and hour later, feeling victorious. There was even a bit of history on the battles at the end there, you can tell the devs actually know a little bit about the history they're depicting here.

The scope of content with this game is pretty vast if you buy the Deluxe Edition which includes all the DLC's, which for around $45USD I feel is a decent deal considering I spent 4+ hours on a single campaign mission and there's loads of them plus a mission editor and multiplayer available as well. It's MoW Assault Squad with old school MoW controls in a well done and researched WW1 setting with that's honestly not that much more rough around the edges than MoW is already (which is to say a lot, but if people are willing to accept the jank in other MoW games I don't know why they aren't here considering there's not that much more beyond the norm) to begin with. 

I for the life of me can't see why so many people seem to dislike it if they claim to like MoW games as a lot of popular MoW mods aren't half as polished as this game is. I'd say on a 1 out of 10 scale this game ranks 7.5-8ish. If you like MoW / Call to Arms / Etc. and feel a WW1 setting sounds cool, this game is definitely not a bad buy at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139177631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1640647776}
review: This game has had "mixed" as its review score since before i bought it a few years ago, and it is the most apt rating it can get. the DLC practices are lame and a snails pace, the voice acting might be so bad its good, but not sure. some take it quite seriously and try their best, others are just reading into a mic. the amount of micro in this game would be genius, if it was refined more, but having to check your individual guys to see their ammo, make a dude from said squad scoop more, make sure it fits diablo style, then redistribute it like a commie, all the while you get no indication that your guys are low or out of ammo, is a bit fricken much. map size and amount of models is spectacular, needs melee options, but whatever, models and stuff.....are ok i guess, beggers cant be choosers when it comes to WW1 games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067360273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1640276868}
review: Poor pathfinding ai leads to very frustrating experience where you are required to micromanage soldiers movement to avoid the types of barbed wire the developers added in(they will automatically avoid barbed wire that is built into the engine eg. barbed wire found in MoW games) unless you want half your soldiers dead or out bandages before they even make contact with the enemy. Trenches never worked very well in the older MoW so you can bet they still don't work well here, machine gun emplacements and mortars getting stuck in the trenches or beneath the ground. The bugs ruin the enjoyment for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218442809', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1872, 'last_played': 1633727824}
review: Really enjoyed this game. The Developers really did their research on WW1 to the point that all the Weapons, Uniforms, Equipment, Nations, Tanks, Automobiles, Vehicles in General are just Perfect Recreations of their real life counter parts. It makes it immensely immersive. All the Negative Reviews are about how the DLC is too expensive but if you have the money i recommend 100% that you buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132760273', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 9197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4781, 'last_played': 1655629288}
review:
This game was fun at first, as sending waves of soldiers into the meat grinder in-game is worth a few hours of entertainment, but I can't recommend this game just to save others from disappointment.

The DLC is evidence of an almost cartoonishly evil greed amongst the developers. They hacked apart the game to sell us the main components as DLC. It's analogous to Ordering a Hamburger and the restaurant charges you $5 for every topping on it. This game is not worth $9, + $7, + $5 + $5 + $1 + $5 + $6 + $5 + $5. This game and its crappy Gem Engine is not worth $50.00

Otherwise, the game fails to in any way capture the brutality of the first world war. Trench Warfare was frequently brutal hand-to-hand combat, but all this seems to depict is lazy potshots at one another from across no man's land. Artillery is frequently so weak it's virtually useless, failing to do any significant damage before the enemy has a chance to bandage themselves. The addition of horses was interesting at a glance, but the soldiers can't do anything from horseback, so attempting to make cavalry charges just results in a lot of dead horses. Hardly spectacular. Gas is rarely used in the campaign, and it's always a cutscene, watching a trenchful of your men just die without any kind of reaction. Nobody puts on the gasmasks that are clearly in their inventories, nobody attempts to run or seek shelter from it. It's like gassing vegetables. Then there are the stealth missions the tedious nature of which causes you to click restart or load save at the smallest of F/U/K-ups.

All in all, a very poor depiction of World War One. 0/10 would not jump in the trenches again even if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066438595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1658838487}
review: No puedo recomendar este juego simplemente  te lo venden incompleto, los juegos como los Sims y otros que te venden un juego en partes son completos comparado con este (se supone que un dlc o expansi√≥n es para complementar el videojuego base) pero lo que quisieron hacer con BoE 1914-1918 es simplemente un desastre. Lo mas triste es que pudo y pudiese llegar a ser el "MOW de la WWI" que uno desear√≠a recomendar y pasar horas jugando pero la desarrolladora abandono lamentablemente este juego. Ademas para jugar una partida escaramuza con la PC deber√°s de comprar un dlc (¬°¬°¬°¬°¬°¬°¬°¬ø¬ø¬ø¬ø¬ø¬øCOMPRAR UN DLC PARA JUGAR CONTRA LA MAQUINA??????!!!!!!) y que ademas cuenta con apenas unos 2-4 mapas para jugar con la IA y el resto contra otros jugadores) Horrible... Pero solo si te gustan los juegos sobre con la tem√°tica de La Gran Guerra (que no precisamente abundan) y tienes el dinero para comprarlo completo pues comprarlo porque es entretenido pero repito solo con todos sus dlcs. Ademas recomiendo en mi opini√≥n comprarlo si o si durante alguna rebaja. Lastima que la desarrolladora olvido este videogame.

review: Never cared for Men Of War, tanks sort of felt way to powerful, in my opinion this feels like a good representation of the Great War, infantry, tanks, cannons they all have a place on the battlefield and I can't say the same quality of balancing to Men Of War. Me and my friend have been enjoying this awesome and underrated game for years and hope for more updates! Maybe an Ottoman faction added?

author: {'steamid': '76561199122423674', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1674499024}
review: My review itself will be kinda negative, however before writing more I simply want to say I recommend this game to people who love multiplayer, I don't, and plus I have a very spotty internet connection. So going in I would recommend this game to most people, just not the minority like me. I bought the skirmish pack thinking it would be like Total War or Steel Division or Wargame, however unlike those you can only play against A.I. and therefore not "with" A.I. such as team mates which I was expecting as it had said that, however also unlike Wargame or Total War, or Steel Division, games that I would recommend far more, you cannot play against A.I. in the skirmish modes without being online which is the dumbest thing ever. That is why I probably won't get much else for the game. Literally only campaign in Single Player, no versing A.I. like I had hoped, well whatever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024000688', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 11498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 107, 'playtime_at_review': 7451, 'last_played': 1711995306}
review:
The game itself is good. Could be better, but there are so few RTS games about World War 1, that despite everything, you will get to like this game, specially if you play multiplayer! There is a mod that Balanced the Game overall, named "Multipalyer Balance Mod" in the Workshop.

Another Mod named "Europe Civil War" is what you will be looking for, as it is the definitive WW1 Experience, it adds several more factions and new assets to the existing ones, as it tries to be as historically acurrate as possible. I managed to find a couple of people who still play the game and organize matches daily, it's wonderful!

If anyone wants to play it, the more we are, the better it will be!

To the vanilla game I give a 7/10

With Any of the 2 mods I mentioned, it's 10/10!

review: It's very long, some missions are boring and I think there is not enough diversity for units but it is an overall fun game. I feel this game helps to fill a gap in WW1 Strategy games and that is what I most appreciate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103050875', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3434, 'last_played': 1675546649}
review:
Quick review time!

Battle of empires is surely an impressive game. I purchased it around the time it came up, and it only improved ever since. The time period it covers(The Great War) is a nice change from the men of war series of games which focus on the next war. The fact that artillery and fixed machineguns are the real damage dealers and most soldiers only have rifles does make a huge difference in gameplay. It feels right and its fun to adapt to this new mechanic.

The game focuses more on single player and as the time this review is written the multiplayer player base consists of a few scarce dedicated players in discord groups. I happen to be part of one myself.

Overall I would say that this game is worth it if you want a WWI strategy game. I myself think that my money was well spend on this one. Pro tip. They do some very nice discount sales from time to time to get the dlcs, watch out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082457267', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1590306535}
review: I just tried it and just can't figure out the controls. I think the game needs a better tutorial. I am used to Total war games and other simulation war games, but this one is by far the most difficult one to understand somehow. And for the price it is not worth it.

review: Can't recommend it, it did show potential when it was still i early access however in the almost 6 years since its been a complete let down, very limited content and a overall failure to depict the great war in any meaningful way, not to mention the stupidity that are the DLC's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126917404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1463277682}
review: I bought the original (which came with tanks and ALL DLC leaving nothing out) which ruined the experience for me. I came back to play  it expecting to play all the missions without a hassle until it hit me with "Must pay for DLC" which i dislike. Yet for those few hours I did play pre cash grab I enjoyed it. Played missions where I had to hold the line, charge in and it was a blast. I hate the fact now that they decided to destroy the game with the DLC.

review:
The idea of this game is very good. The downside, and the developers should be ashamed, is not having opened access to the units and packages to be able to modify and perform mods. Do you think that by doing this you would earn more money? At all, look around you, the whole saga has good sales, you have lost a game with a lot of potential. I claim that the game will be completely for modification, you will see how it is reborn.
The rest, the game, like the whole saga. Very good. 
----------------------
La idea de este juego es muy buena. Lo malo, y le tiene que dar verguenza a los desarrolladores, es no haber abierto el acceso a las unidades y paquetes para poder modificar y realizar mods. Igual os pensais que haciendo esto ganar√≠asis m√°s dinero?. En absoluto, mirad a vuestro alrededor, toda la saga tiene buenas ventas, vosotros hab√©is dejado perder un juego con mucho potencial. Reclamo que se habra el juego al completo para su modificaci√≥n, ver√©is como renace.
El resto, el juego, como toda la saga. Muy bien.

review:
Even tho its a pretty much overpaid mod of men of war,the campaign can be pretty fun especially the french,uk and blazing gun which is worth to buy (on discount sale of course).Other campaign other than 3 pretty meh but they do have their own charm in it.Multiplayer is death so buy this game only for the single player only.I like the gore and the scream the dev added in this game,can be pretty brutal and fitting to ww1 theme.
    Oh yeah if you buy this game alone without any DLC,you only get training mission so make sure you buy this game on sale.Overall its 6/10,would give it 7 if they don't have the overprice dlc stuff

author: {'steamid': '76561198065589295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2387, 'last_played': 1611169338}
review:
Very neat concept, and fun if you're already a fan of the MOW series, but it has many many flaws. The AI, particularly those you command, are abysmal. You can give them an order to charge a trenchline (crucial when a machinegun or artillery is shredding them, and they will either casually walk or not move at all half the time! This makes for very frustrating moments where you lose many of your men due simply to the fact they ignore your orders. Also, not sure if it's a product of the base game or one of the "Real War" DLC, but it is not uncommon for a dead unit to, in a "dramatic" death, throw a random grenade  as their last act. This is incredibly frustrating, not only because many of them don't even carry grenades in the first place, but because it creates situations where someone you just killed suddenly suicide bombs your entire squad. This even happens in stealth missions, where you silently kill an enemy and they blow themselves up next to you! 

The missions are fun and well-thought out, but also far too ambitious for what the game is. Even on the easiest difficulty, you'll often lose over half of your men attempting to accomplish an objective, often due to the issues mentioned above, only for the map to suddenly expand, give you more objectives and more enemies, but give you no reinforcements to help. Missions just never seem to end, which means even those you do really well on, you'll have to either quit without success, or spend over an hour just trying to wrap it up. 

Also, the UI and many elements are very clunky, and resemble a mod more than a full game. Debug text is still visible in certain options, graphics are somehow lower than the game it spawned off of to begin with, and certain mechanics (gas and gas masks, horses, grenades) just don't work how they should. If this was an early access game, or one which came out years before MOWAS, then I would understand these shortcomings. But it is a full release, only five years old, and already seems dead. Highly unfortunate.

review:
BoE to typowy RTS, a nawet Real Time Tactics, bo nie tworzymy tu jednostek, a jedynie czasem mamy mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá wezwania posi≈Çk√≥w czy uzupe≈Çnie≈Ñ. Dlatego w zale≈ºno≈õci od misji - przejmujemy dowodzenie nad oddzia≈Çem wielko≈õci plutonu (tu uwa≈ºamy na ≈ºycie ka≈ºdego cz≈Çonka ekipy), a w kolejnej rzucamy w b√≥j kompaniƒô za kompaniƒÖ niczym miƒôso armatnie.
To zr√≥≈ºnicowanie sprawia, ≈ºe ka≈ºdy zapalony militarysta znajdzie co≈õ dla siebie. Gra pozornie niezachƒôcajƒÖca do gry na d≈Çu≈ºszƒÖ metƒô potrafi zaskakujƒÖco wciƒÖgnƒÖƒá i sprawiƒá, ≈ºe nieraz powtarzamy misjƒô nie dlatego, ≈ºe siƒô nie uda≈Ça, ale stwierdzamy na koniec, ≈ºe strata 40-50% kompanii jest zbyt bolesna, albo w kolejnej czƒô≈õci misji bƒôdzie nam brakowaƒá - np snajpera. System gry zawiera kilka ciekawych smaczk√≥w mo≈ºemy przeszukaƒá ekwipunek zneutralizowanego wroga (zabieramy amunicjƒô, banda≈ºe - tak w chwili wytchnienia mo≈ºemy zobaczyƒá jak nasi soldaci zak≈ÇadajƒÖ opatrunki !).
Pomimo dynamizmu rozgrywki sƒÖ spokojniejsze momenty i pozwalajƒÖ napawaƒá siƒô chwilƒÖ przerwy w walkach i spokojnie przegrupowaƒá oddzia≈Ç i ruszyƒá do kolejnego zadania do tego klimat pierwszej wojny ≈õwiatowej i rewelacyjna praca kamery z du≈ºym zoomem daje rado≈õƒá z gry. 

Niestety z kilku minus√≥w najbardziej bardzo brakuje tu jednak aktywnej pauzy. Kolejnym jest zachowanie przeciwnik√≥w i mimo gry na poziomi real war sƒÖ czƒôsto do wystrzelania jak kaczki, zw≈Çaszcza patrole, ale tu mo≈ºna nieraz siƒô zdziwiƒá jak zaciƒôty potrawiƒÖ stawiaƒá op√≥r, raz zaskoczy≈Ço mnie rzucenie granatu, kt√≥ry przeciwnik odrzuci≈Ç z okopu czym uratowa≈Ç nie tylko siebie, ale i kilku swych kamrat√≥w. 

Osobi≈õcie przypad≈Çy mi do gustu misje gdzie dowodzimy plutonem i wykonujemy zadania w stylu starego dobrego komandosa, przy czym strata jednego czy kilku ludzi nie ko≈Ñczy siƒô pora≈ºkƒÖ, aczkolwiek widok zastrzelonego w biegu za najbli≈ºszƒÖ os≈Çonƒô podw≈Çadnego wywo≈Çuje smutne emocjƒô. Polecam wszystkim fanatykom i laikom, czƒôste promocje pozwolƒÖ kupiƒá jƒÖ za grosz i spƒôdziƒá kilka przyjemnych godzin na rozgrywce :-).

Na koniec ma≈Çe ostrze≈ºenie, kupi≈Çem w super przecenie 90% czyli ok 4z≈Ç, pomimo pe≈Çnej nazwy Battle of Empires 1914-1918, gra zawiera≈Ça jedynie misje szkoleniowƒÖ (znajomo≈õƒá angielskiego na poziomie podstawowym u≈Çatwi rozgrywkƒô) - chocia≈º przyznam, ≈ºe zaciƒÖ≈Çem siƒô na takiej czynno≈õci jak za≈Çadowanie dzia≈Ça ;/, oraz kilka misji po jednej z ka≈ºdej kampanii, chyba 5. 
Same kampanie natomiast dostƒôpne sƒÖ ka≈ºda osobno w DLC po 18 z≈Ç jedna i zawiera 7 misji ! Zatem czy warto ? p√≥ki co zakupi≈Çem  niemieckƒÖ - ≈ÇƒÖcznie rozegra≈Çem ok 18 h, mam wra≈ºenie ≈ºe nie odpuszczƒô tak szubko, planujƒô doko≈Ñczyƒá przy ok 40 h. To pozwoli ≈Çatwo obliczyƒá koszt zabawy - 22z≈Ç/40h co daje 55 gr za godzinƒô :D, zobaczymy. Ja polecam !

review: Buen juegos es una copia del men of war, lo unico que lo diferencia es que esta basado en la primera guerra mundial aunque dicha diferencia es nula ya que te espaunean tanques como si eso fuera la blitzkrieg, las unidades a veces se atascan y tienes que volver a clikar para que se muevan, tiene fallos como que los vehiculos con ametralladoras (que viene siendo un coche de epoca con una torreta con una ametralladora y unas chapas de proteccion) necesitas hasta 5 disparos de ca√±on de campo es decir que tiene el sistema de da√±o de un tanque de la segunda guerra mundial sin serlo, en lo personal me gusta por ser una copia de un men of war ( uno de los mejores RTS de la segunda guerra mundial), pero mucho mas baratos que los men of war originales ya que en oferta lo encuentras por centimos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037682187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1922, 'last_played': 1652461995}
review: Putting aside the devs decision to cut this game into dlc's and the fact that it still has some bugs here and there (Men of War engine so this is no surprise for me) this is really a nice WW I game. It has a lot of different campaigns so we can play as Entante as well as Central Powers all of which consist of nicely done, interesting missions with differrent pacing. The devs put in a lot of new mechanics for a MoW engine game such as gas attacks and schrapnel shells to name a few. author: {'steamid': '76561198045164841', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1605287668}
review:
Trench hopping ludological activities are few and far between these days. Doing no favours to this interest is the fact that the unpopular Olympics of 1914-1918 cemented themselves in the mind of strategy-gaming-enthusiasts as a crazy ‚Äú100 meter no man‚Äôs land dash‚Äù. Sure, Battlefield 1 gave it asucessful and romanticized go in 2016 but the spark of muddy-holes-in-Flanders warfare failed to ignite the flames of game developers everywhere. In fact, while doing research for this piece I 100% blame EA and DICE for the subsequent downfall of WW1 gaming.

[url=https://onehexaway.wordpress.com/2020/11/13/battle-of-empires-1914-1918-is-the-best-ww1-rts-out-there-and-you-should-really-give-it-a-go/] Read more at: Onehexaway.wordpress.com  [/url]

A less than memorable game title and even less than stellar visuals and an overall lack of polish can deceive even the most open-minded wargamers in the wild to trow out Battle of Empires 1914-1918 deep into the the nearest rat-shit-filled trench. But a brief two week scuffle with COVID had me locked up, unable to work and wishing for a familiar, conforting formula in real-time-stratego. I had bought BoE a couple of years back but never gave it a fair shot. A boring first mission that has you, the commander taking control of a french detachment ambushed by germans while riding a train doesn‚Äôt do much to sell the great game that lies beyond the deep layer of first impressions.

French poilus will go on to have great (mis)adventures across the four years of World War 1. BoE excells in depicting the tecnological advances that ocurred across the conflict. It does not lose itself in details nor it tries to force it down your throat (Cough! Battlefield 1! Cough!), it‚Äôs surprisingly organic. In the early-war missions french units are sporting their iconic red trousers and blue coats. Give a couple assignments in the poilus are now dressing the horizon-blue tinted tunics and trousers. The red, white and blue cap has given way to the M15 Casque Adrien. Besides the visual candy, the campaign also introduces new weapons and equipment that range from more bolt action to semi automatic rifles, the chauchat light machine gun and even the Renault FT, the first tank to flaunt a rotating turret.


If you know a thing or two about Men of War (whose engine this game clearly borrows and takes it for a long, afternoon stroll across early 20th century Europe) then it will come as no surprise that every single units is important and there is no such thing as cannon fodder. I was intrigued to see how BoE would deal with the massive slaughter of World War 1 while trying to keep the focus on small scale units tactics in which this engine eclipses any other. If one wishes to ignore the really extremely minuscule scale of one or two single soldiers mission and focus more on 15 and plus then usually BoE hands you the command of a section of the map and tasks you with very specific tasks. All the while the massive scale of World War 1 rages around you, making you feel a part of a greater conflict. Missions usually are lenghty and multi-phased affairs, with general staff constantly updating mission objectives and always keeping the CO on their toes.

Unpredictability is not a good thing when you‚Äôre making tough decisions on how to tackle a hard objective. Sure you can rush your infantry forward getting everyone killed but the single hero that hoists the flag, capture the point and be done with it. Shit hits the fan if you‚Äôre then tasked with fighting off the undending waves of huns rushing your strongpoint and no reinforcements are expected. While I‚Äôm not a fan of pulling the rug from under the player in strategy games as a whole, the way it‚Äôs implemented here asks the player to treat their pixeltruppen with some special care, and I‚Äôm unapologetically okay with that.

Battle of Empires might not be love at first sight but it carries some endearing qualities that will keep you coming back to it after those temporary trench-hopping surges have passed. While I‚Äôve focused on the french in this small article I can assure you that both the British and German campaign pack the same love and attention from the developers. You can buy it on Steam for its regular price of 7,39 euros or wait for a sale and get the entire compendium in a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008098582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1600744835}
review:
I think some of the reviews for this game have been a bit unfair to the developers.  While some of the feedback is on point much of it is not.  First the graphics, I think they are on par if not a little more detailed than other MOW games and I own every one.  While I agree the controls are a little on the wonky side, where they basically break the left click, right click standard and use left click for most every thing they can be gotten used to and controls alone should not doom a game.  I have read other reviews that seemed to complain about finding more ammo for the troops but think this is modeled correctly for that period.  The ammo was very heavy so soldiers could only carry a limited amount.  When they ran out miles from the base there was not some magic resupply wagon, they had to make due by borrowing ammo from their buddies or looting dead bodies or captured supply creates.  In some cases they switched and started using the enemy's weapon.  Point is they figured it out which the game correctly models.  With big guns they didn't load themselves and once loaded fire continuously without end.  They had to be reloaded by carting ammo from ammo wagons or crates to the big guns, again the concept of moving the shells to a soldiers inventory and then to the guns is the correct modeling and creates a firing delay while reloading.   The game has a lot of cover and the controls for positioning soldiers behind cover are straight forward and intuitive, once you get used to doing it with a left click.  The maps I've played have an amazing amount of detail and loads of cover points so I don't think the criticism in that area has been fair either.  Not all that said the game does have its problems.  The one that I think is most important is a pathing issue where soldiers take a direct route to their destination in stead of say following the trench as you might have ordered.  Also in a rush it is easy to leave troops behind as they don't always get selected in a left click selection box.  Last is the default content.  This for me is an issue.  Be default the game comes with a couple of training missions(Bootcamp) and the prologue campaign.  That's it! Every thing else, all of the factions(French, English, German, Russian ect. and  all of the associated campaigns for those factions mentioned in the games write up are offered as DLC.  The publisher claims this is to give people more choice in putting together the game they want in a more budget friendly way, but the base game is so limited on actual content the approach comes off as a full game that was broken into parts as a sort of cash grab.  My recommendation would be to repackage the game with all of the faction dlc and their base campaigns into the main game and convert the additional battles as DLC for folks that wanted additional missions or battles beyond the main campaigns.  Still my overall impression is that it is a good game, a fun one for what little there is in the base game and it does a nice job with this period. 

 I also always try to support developers that produce single player content and really like the sort of story approach they have taken with each of the faction campaigns even though they forced me to spend more money than I paid for the base game.  I don't mind the COH or even Total War approach to DLCs but here there is so little base content  that it seems a bit unfair!

author: {'steamid': '76561198274146480', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1593603746}
review:
Although this game was released after MoWAS2, it's using an older engine than MoWAS2. Graphics from pre-MoWAS2 era and same with accessibility. Squad selection icon in MoWAS2 is a very important QoL feature. Also, MoWAS2 is the only game in MoW franchise which allows you to use additional buttons on the gaming mouse. 

Voice acting is as bad as in MoW games. Not even talking about English version. 

Melee combat is crap. It's not very important for MoW games, since MoW games set in WWII era but BoE is a WWI game... You have shashka (No. It's not a name. It's a type of saber used by Cossacks), sabers and of course throwables like knives and axes. Melee combat is the same in all games since it was introduced.

Stealth is bad. I used bushes as cover and enemies spotted me. Stealth plays big role in some missions.

In short. I haven't noticed any QoL updates in this game, and it has all problems from MoW games. Buy only if you love WWI era, with big discount or if the price in your region is low. I personally love RTT games these days, but I'm not a masochist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968675002', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1591293853}
review:
lots of potential but not playable.

But the game breaking shit was reloading.  I could find no way to resupply my men other than running each one back and forth to ammo crates.  The required micro for this means i can do nothing else with 80+ men.  Im sure there is a way to do this better, but it isnt mentioned in any guide, or in the tutorial, and i cant search online because the name makes it impossible to search for game guides without getting historical stuff instead.

So in the first defense of the trainyard, i wreck shit until out of ammo then my men sit and die.

Horrible

(if anyone can explain how this is done in the comments, i will reconsider the review.)

review: This game is pretty awesome, Id advise a slightly faster graphics card. Since there is not always an artillery strike ready when you need it to clear out the excess of opposing forces. Over all i really dig it there are a couple things that take some time getting use to but other then that once you get the basic mechanics down this game is A1. And that all being in reference to the basic game. Time to add on to it

author: {'steamid': '76561198053940839', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 730, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1582587646}
review: Battle of Empires: 1914-1918 spielt im 1. Weltkrieg. Es ist ein Echtzeitstrategie-Spiel mit ganz annehmbaren Grafiken und Animationen. Die Standard-Version umfasst nur einige Ausbildungs-Karten. Wenn man die gro√üen Kampagnen und Gefechte spielen m√∂chte, muss man sich ein, oder mehrere Erweiterungen kaufen. Es gibt unz√§hlige Stellungsgefechte und Grabenk√§mpfe. Das ist zwar nicht sehr spannend, aber typisch f√ºr den 1. Weltkrieg. Bei den Waffen und Fahrzeugen hat man sich an die geschichtlichen Vorgaben gehalten. Es sehr viele Auswahlm√∂glichkeiten. Das ganze ist sehr komplex. Vor der Schlacht muss man die gew√ºnschten Waffen und die dazu passende Munition in die Rucks√§cke packen. Das ist sehr zeitaufwendig und nervig. Oft beginnt die Schlacht schon bevor man seine Soldaten organisiert hat. Dazu kommt eine umst√§ndliche Steuerung. Viele der Buttons sind sehr un√ºbersichtlich und man sucht oft viel zu lange. Die Reichweiten der Einheiten werden nicht angezeigt. Das l√§sst sich bei der Infanterie vielleicht noch verschmerzen, macht aber ein effektives Angreifen mit der Artillerie unm√∂glich. Die nervigen Sounds, wenn man beispielsw. einen Soldaten anklickt, lassen sich zum Gl√ºck noch ausschalten. Am besten lehnt man sich zur√ºck und beobachtet wie die verb√ºndeten NPC-Truppen die Arbeit machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995782440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1576525380}
review:
The UI Is cancer in every way.

example: You have to labouriously drag shells from a box 6 at a time then take them to an artillery gun to reload it for instance. Good luck doing this when you have 200 other men to manage at the same time. 

example 2: To put down sandbags you have to open an inventory of an engineer and double click to equip it before it appears in the build menu, then once you build it disappears again. Also, there's no obvious way to rotate them.

The buttons are tiny even if you lower yourself to 1080p resolution.

review:
+Accurate RTS and a great ww1 simulater/experience.
+High attention to details, ammo, explosives, cordination and so on is really though through.

-The controls are somewhat akward, also it is not possible to make 1 to 10 groups.
-This is a game that wants micromanagement like CoH while being a large scale game like Supream Commander at the same time.
-The voiceacting is broken on purpose to compensate for dialects and accents.
-While models are realistic, there is only 1 voiceactor pr faction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417069256', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1709635523}
review:
Alright, I am going to start by saying I bought this game without any idea of what I was doing. I just looked at it and said: "Guns!" and bought it. Was it a good decision? 

Short answer: not really

Long answer:
+PROS
Its realistic and also feels quite realistic. The graphics are quite nice, although not the best. Also quite beginner friendly. 
-CONS
The base game has 5 missions in it. That's it. That's all. Want more missions? Buy the super expensive DLC.
It's a game you cannot replay. And after paying 15‚Ç¨ I need more than 5 missions. Dlcs are supposed to be extras, not be the main game.

Wasted potential really. Could have been a great game. 

Rating: 4/10 would not buy again

author: {'steamid': '76561197993368913', 'num_games_owned': 2098, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1595022635}
review:
Very fun game. It is Men of War in WWI and it is an enjoyable experience. I have played through the prologue and the british campaign and i got more than enough value for my money and i will probably try out another campaign when i feel like coming back.

The missions are varied and there are everything from small scouting missions to huge battles in a number of different locations. Sometimes the AI can be a bit weird and i had some sound problems as well at times but nothing distracted from the pure fun i had with some of the missions in this game. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015892370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1572824279}
review: The gameplay isn't great. It jumps around, its hard to command your troops, the mini-map design is the worst I've ever seen in an RTS, and the AI is inconsistent. Secondly if you want to play single player you can only play through the prologue then you have to buy their DLC, and this game isn't worth the price of one of their DLC's. So I would avoid it entirely until all of the DLC is free.

review: The game itself feels like a mod for Men of War and for obvious reasons lacks the machines and equipment in Men of War as this is set in World War One. In all I played through the French Campaign and have to say I enjoyed it. There is a nice little tutorial mission which I think greatly benefited my experience. I did pay full price for the game but I always like to support smaller developers, although knowing what I know now it's certainly not worth the price, however I would buy it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013296662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2243, 'last_played': 1678272550}
review:
I really like this game.  It's quite realistic, especially with infantry and mortar tactics.  The gas mechanics are really cool.  I like the artillery towing and some of the tricks you can do, such as mounting an officer and using his binoculars on horseback as a scout to order strikes.
It can be a bit to rock/paper/scissors and base-campaign is an issue.
But those are't the problems.

Why don't I recommend a game I enjoy?
DLC campaigns make it pricier than it is worth.
The multiplayer is dead, so the only thing left is DLC campaigns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026636405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1692, 'last_played': 1549241185}
review:
Online lobbies are virtually noexistent plus the campaign is a bit annoying considering how this is basically just Men At war Assault Squad but set in World War 1 but way too poorly done, which is a shame because there was alot of potential for this. I would've loved to play a skirmish match against the AI like in MAW (Men At War) but there's no chance of that now. 

While on the topic of the campaign, it does have some unique elements to it that sets it apart from MAW and in a good way such as the fact that you can interact with the dialog and chose different path which will affect the overall path on the map you play on. However the most distracting part in the dialog is how unbelivably slow it moves and how poor the voice acting is (Ill get to that in a second). In addition the controls are a bit strange for an RTS game all things considered, I mean it plays just the same as most other rts games except for the movement commands, for example in most strategy games you left click on a unit and right click on a destination to tell it to move, in this one you left click to select a unit and then left click again to tell it to move or attack while right clicking deselects the unit. I know this is more of a nitpick rather than a criticism but it really bugs me so it goes in the review, I mean i spent 10 minutes on my first mission trying to figure out why my units weren't moving and every time I come back to this game i do the same thing for about a minute because every other rts game i play has the same mouse controls except this one.

On a very positive note, I've never seen a very serious war game allow your soldiers to pickup and equip a chicken in combat. I laughed for a solid 5 minutes as I sent and entire squad armed with nothing but chickens straight at the enemy.

The most irritating part for me is the English accented Germans in the German campaign, I kept thinking they were British. You could've given them a stereotypical German accent or at the very least a bad accent, at least at that point you could say you tried to make them sound German. I know I sound a bit hysterical about this but I mean come on, HOW HARD IS IT DO DO A GERMAN ACCENT!!??

author: {'steamid': '76561198364865065', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1666894852}
review: Battle of Empires : 1914-1918 is game from timeline of World War II.You can play for German Empire,Austria-Hungary,France,Russia and others main superpowers what they fought in this war.Game have high quality of equipment,from rifles to tanks.There is lots of style of the battles a like main attack or stealth mission.You can defend your position on gallipoli or go to offensive on somme.You can buy DLCs to this game for little money what they give you new battles or new faction.This game is like Verdun or Tannenberg from strategy perspective.I give to this game 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170194217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1598518227}
review: I'll be completely honest, I bought this for the Victory Pack, which takes place during WW2. I was looking for some great battle of berlin action and that didn't disappoint. However, after finishing it, I found myself checking the rest of it out and let me just say, WW1 Men of War is absolutely amazing. It isn't as static as you expect the Great War was, what with the trench warfare seesawing going on. So far, I've experienced ambushes, attacks on towns and cities, armored attack and defense, guerrila actions, and indeed, a fair amount of trench warfare. Yet it still greatly interests me and sparked a mildly dormant WW1 curiosity in me that rivals to the height of when I was studying WW2. To the front!

author: {'steamid': '76561198394006499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1596998585}
review: I had seen the game on Steam but the reviews weren't great so I didn't bother in the past.  During the Christmas sale I decided to give the game a try and I'm glad I did.  I play Men of War Assault Squad 2 a lot and for me the only problem is getting used to some of he controls.  Mostly moving troops with the left mouse button instead of the right was the hardest to get used to.  Overall the campaigns are really enjoyable. There doesn't seem to be much of a multiplayer community and   I wish the skirmish pack was more like MOWAS2 to be honest.   Overall, however, I think it is the best game out there for the WW1 era as far as I am concerned.  You can tell they put a great deal of thought into the game.  If you like single player campaign-based games I would highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165530339', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1625610797}
review: The scummy practices of the devs can't be stated enough, the base game only comes with like one campaign you even have to download a DLC in order to use the map/mission editor, and you'll need to buy the campaigns for every other nation. I managed to get the "delux" edition when it was one sale for around $12 which came with everything, I wouldn't buy the game otherwise, but that being said the gameplay is fun and like al the other men of war titles, but don't buy the game unless its on sale, its just not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006448212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1656838211}
review:
A amateurish paid mod on top of the MoW engine.
Pros:
- World War 1 setting
- Similar control to many MoW games. You will be right at home if you play the MoW series since this is a mod (developers started out as a WW1 mod but turn it into a paid mod because of greed).  Too bad, greed is only good if you have a good product to sell.

Cons:
- Buggy MP 
- Dead MP yet developer tried to pump MP content like an obsession while community begged for SP content
- Tone-deaf developer
- Greed!  Nickle and dime every single piece of SP and sell them as SP campaign
- very poorly designed SP campaign (bland and boring)

review:
Hallo liebes Great War Team,
erstens m√∂chte ich sagen, dass ihr wirklich gute Arbeit macht. Ich habe nicht nur Boe ( Battle of Empires 1914-1918) gespielt, sondern auch alle Man of War Teile. Ihr habt ein wirklich gutes Spiel entwickelt. Aber etwas ist nicht so gut. 
1. Der Deutsche Sch√ºtze hat keinen Stahlhelm was mich ein bisschen st√∂rt, weil wenn ich Sch√ºtzen und zb. Strumtruppen zusammen k√§mpfen lasse sieht das nicht so korekt f√ºr mich aus. Ich bin ein sehr Geschichtstreuer Mensch und liebe realistische Spiele die sich an die Geschichte halten.
2. Es sollte gr√∂√üere Maps und dazu gleich auch noch gr√∂√üere Reichweiten f√ºr die Waffen haben.
3. Die reguleren Soldaten (also Sch√ºtzen) sollten jeweils jeder auser der Offizier eine Handgranate haben.

Ich w√§re sehr dankbar wenn sie das lesen und sich das durch den Kopf gehen lassen oder vielleicht sogar was von dieser Liste umsetzen w√ºrden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056448886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1695399605}
review:
Well, what can you say but that it is a game.   The movement of troops on a WW1 battlefield was somewhat like that of Russian Tactics in WW2.  That means there would be a large number of troops sent forward to take the trench lines.  The fact that they would try to use artillery to soften up the attack spot first telegraphed the punch long before it was pushed.  This allowed the other side to bring in support, wake up the counter battery fire of the artillery and have hundreds if not thousands to repulse the attack.  So there is limited troops on the map.   I noted medicial was not there either.  Those poor smucks would go out into no man's land and pick up the hurt before the attack was even half way over.   That means they would be unarmed and helpless if a large counter attack took place before they were expecting it.    So WW1 this aint!  It is close, and a good want to be.  If each figure was equal to 60 men, it would be more dead on.

The landscape has to much green on it for it to be real.   No enough bodies in different stages of decomposing is also missing.  So it is to clean.  The muck and the mud, isn't there.   So places were knee deep in the stuff.  The trenches are to neat and clean as well and mice are no where to be seen.  There had to be a number of them running here and there with any attack because they would be feasting on the dead in no man's land.  

Aircraft is a real nice touch, but too low and at the height the game has them they would be toast before they flew over one time.  Now that is for realism.  Game play is good, easy and fast to learn.  Has a game play help and so history in the mix.  I would say that over all the game is great, but not WW1.   I haven't played a great deal of the games in it, but it is very much like other games of this type and you are either carefull or your not.  If your not you lose, sorta like in life.

I would say buy it and enjoy, knowing that it is cleaner than real life, and yet you will get some of the facts of history.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243437536', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1495308746}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021955988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6084, 'last_played': 1548953421}
review: This game does have a lot of issues. The DLC policy is ridiculous and some of the main factions (such as Britain Germany and Russia) campaigns of ww1 should not be dlc. Likewise they should expand on the editor as that is what a lot of people, including myself, love about men of war series. The artillery is pretty powerful, and attacking in this game is really hard as any faction (including those I have added).  I would recommend this game though, as it can be fun sometimes, but is not with its full price (with all the dlcs you need like editor). They do update every so often to add some more things. But I think they really could expand on the maps for editor and would help make getting the editor more worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993497500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1610786291}
review:
Pros:
- solid and challenging missions
- massive scale - many dozens of units acting simulteniously
- devastating artillery (including gas shells)
- does feel like Great War - lots of losses every second
Cons:
- a bit old engine
- be ready for lots of micromanagement and bullet time
Final thoughts:
- solid Great War game for real generals who are ready to overcome lots of deadly challenges and dive into all the details of tactical battles of that era

author: {'steamid': '76561198799594928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1548096497}
review:
I like it so much!!! 

I believe that you all are familiar with the MOW series in which the setting was World War 2.Here it is exactly the same, only it is for World War 1 (many great mods for WW2, Vietnam as well as Modern warfare). The developers have done a good job, adding historicaly accurate DLCs, added several important aditions to the editor compared to Men of War.

Do not listen to the bad reviews, everyone who had played any of the MOW series will find this very fun and will add it to their library.

The game's only downside is that the week days, not a lot of players are on but this doesn't happen in weekends and in vacations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046401683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1538258667}
review:
Tldr; ADD MULTIPLAYER BOTS. 

My story with the game: 

Okay, so I'm a huge MOW fan, loved it to death. For some reason i've been feeling drawn toward ww1 lately. For no particular reason. I had no idea this game had existed and I was INSANELY excited to see this game exist. 

But i found a lot of negative reviews. I was uncertain about the game. I decided to torrent it to see if I would like it and if it would be worth a purchase. 

My internet is insanely slow so I used 2.9 gigs of my phone data. That shows how excited I was. 

Anyway the torrent had only access to single player. And it was total ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• 

The single player is unplayable. It's horridly voice acted and not fun. It cannot be understated how bad the single player is. 

Part of the reason that mow 2 was fun was the sandbox nature. I could pick my plan of attack. And i felt like i could lose. 

Every bullet, character, and second is scripted. And my god is it bad. 

I was raging mad. I WAS ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ING‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•JESUS. I was so hyped and what is this‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• 

But I saw a great core being squandered. The torrent had no access to the multiplayer AI (it's really single player) 

I bought the game with very low expectation. Hoping against hope the multiplayer would be good. And it's shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009817827', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1596766966}
review:
A very good game in the Men of War engine with a few issues. Most notably:

-difficulty is all over the place. For example, the first Russian mission has you sabotaging some trains guarded by about 200 Germans with a total of less than a dozen men. The second mission has you defending a town with hundreds of men and artillery against Germans who basically walk across a field at you.
-field artillery is laser accurate and extremely deadly. This can either be a bit comical or extremely annoying depending on the mission
-the voice acting is really bizzare at times

Despite what many negative reviews say, these things are far from game-ruining. The devs clearly aren't professionals with a great deal of resources and these issues reflect that. However, the solid experience far outweighs these cons in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010984518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6421, 'last_played': 1548620851}
review:
Yes the game has some rough spots, but I  enjoy it for the most part. ESPECIALLY the editor, I've spent countless hours recreating famous ww1 battles/scenarios, gets pretty addicting. The campaign suffers from difficulty/ slight bugs, and horrendous voice acting. However, I still find joy in it, especially since most nations are playable. (Give us Italy please).

Overall, 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973326818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 39784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37735, 'last_played': 1518360175}
review:
Das Spiel "Battle of Empires : 1914-1918" ist ein Echtzeit-Strategiespiel, jedoch ohne die Aufbaukomponete wie bei "Command & Conquer". Auch ist die Action-Komponente hinter der taktischen Herausforderung, obwohl es auch genug gro√üe Schlachten gibt.
Im Spiel √ºber nimmt an die Rolle vom Gruppenf√ºhrer bis Kompanie-Chef, wobei bei letzterer die F√ºhrung der Truppe w√§hrend gro√üen Schlachten schon recht herausfordert ist.
Was die Operationen "leichter" ist die M√∂glichkeit, zu jeder Zeit den Spielstand abzuspeichern. So kann man bei falscher F√ºhrung entsprechend zur√ºckspringen, statt die Mission vom Anfang zu beginnen.
Zu den prim√§ren Zielen gibt es auch viele sekund√§re sowie auch versteckte, die entsprechend mit Auszeichnungen gew√ºrdigt werden. Bef√∂rderugnen gibt es in diesem Sinne nicht.
Eine sch√∂ne und interessante Sache ist, da√ü die Perspektive v√∂llig frei gew√§hlt werden kann: Von Vogelsicht und auf 300 m Gel√§deabschnitt herausgezoomt bis zur Egoperskeptive, wo jeder Knopf der Uniform sichtbar ist.
Material, Waffen und Uniform sind sehr detailiert und realistisch gestaltet.
Fazit: Freude der Close Combat-Reihe (oder Combat Mission) sind bei diesem Spiel absolut richtig!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065307824', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1514608836}
review:
Um jogo muito bom e viciante de ser jogado, e super recomendado para quem √© f√£ da I Guerra.

O que mais me atraiu aten√ß√£o neste jogo foi a sua atmosfera e a din√¢mica de combate. A atmosfera do jogo faz o jogador imergir dentro da Primeira Guerra com seus cen√°rios de √©poca, uniformes muito bem feitos, casas e vilas com a arquitetura caracter√≠stica desse per√≠odo. Jogo foi muito bem detalhado e desenhado pois consegue dar a sensa√ß√£o de se estar passeando (ou batalhando) em uma fazenda ou cidade europeia do in√≠cio do s√©culo XX (Al√©m de outros cen√°rios como fortes ou praias). O outro ponto que tamb√©m me atraiu bastante foi a din√¢mica de combate, pois o jogo possibilita v√°rias maneiras de se chegar ao objetivo, atrav√©s de cen√°rios interativos, pontos estrat√©gicos diferentes, combina√ß√µes de combate variadas. Ao se jogar uma campanha v√°rias vezes, voc√™ pode ter v√°rios resultados e maneiras distintas. Tamb√©m achei interessante que pelo pouco tempo que joguei percebi que os criadores ainda d√£o suporte para a comunidade.

O que eu n√£o gostei no jogo foi que a Intelig√™ncia Artificial das unidades √© muito ruim. Al√©m disso o controle de c√¢mera e das unidades tamb√©m s√£o muito fracos. Tamb√©m achei negativo pois o jogo possui v√°rias expan√ß√µes (que ao meu ver s√£o ess√™nciais de um ponto de vista hist√≥rico para imers√£o no jogo) que acaba tornando o jogo muito caro para ter o mesmo completo.  N√£o compre as expans√µes se n√£o estiverem em promo√ß√£o.

O jogo est√° muito bom e possui muito pontencial que n√£o √© desenvolvido pelos criadores. Se quem jogar gostar de RTS, I Guerra e jogos atmosf√©ricos, esse jogo √© o ideal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981385591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1511415213}
review:
This game is not for your Starcraft Rushers or your Command & Conquerers. Total Warriors may find something here, but even they may be too action addicted to succeed at BoE. 
This is the thinking man's RTS and the History Buff's dream come true.
If you enjoy Men of War or the Commandos games, this is up your alley, but I recommend it to any patient tactician willing to treat each soldier like a real person instead of unnamed cannon fodder.

review:

C'est un probl√®me d'ergonomie et de logique. Je veux une grenade ou des obus √† tel endroit, svp, au coeur d'une bataille palpitante, ne faites pas qu'on est √† se taper en revu l'inventaire des 50 gars pour savoir qui √† le sac, qui a le barbel√©, qui a l'obus, qui a la grenade...
Je veux √ßa l√†, et les gars dans le groupe ou la section se d√©merdent. Et quel bordel pour installer une rang√©e de sac ou de barbel√©... c'est impossible, √ßa part dans tous les sens...
Le vrai plus, c'est "l'auto soin" des gars qui sont sans ordre, ils prennent le temps de se soigner, √ßa c'est logique!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994445792', 'num_games_owned': 1658, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1702197018}
review:
This game is just like any of the Men of War games, but with lots of DLC that should've been included in the first place.

The worst part is that now my computer believes it has a virus because of this game.

I wanted this game for the WWI setting, I was looking forward to the trench warfare, but a lot of the battles are smaller in terms of soldiers you get to control. Also the voice acting is terrible (I can't take it seriously for a moment).

Trust me when I say you would be better off getting one of the Men of War games instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036657203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1603572109}
review:
The game was working fine then suddenly all save games and the progress of saving game begin to cause a fatal crash.

So now you cant save the game or load it and when it autosaves it crashes too..

Shame cause it was a nice game...
developer_response:
Check your rights to write into the folder with game profle. If this folder is not allowed for saving, the game will be unabel to save and crash.
Writing into the folder may also be forbidden by the Antivirus. If it so, try to disable it or add game profile folder into the exception list.

review: Prety buggy and poor animated. Watched my troops build sandbags by beating the ground without a shovel. Guys kept running into an open field to grab the rifle right in front of the enemy's LMG instead of the one wo feet from them that i ordered to click. When the squad was prone and crawling i looked closely. I watched the rifle floating next to them like jesus taking the rifle. I laughed so hard they got shelled by artillery and died 10/10 will watch soldiers crawl with jesus holding their rifle. All in all, its not a bad game. Just needs a lot of patches, and a skirmish mode would be nice too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245391202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1579313660}
review:
Yes all the complaints are true. This started out as a mod for the very popular and well liked Men of War series. And yes, the idea of a small company acting like a AAA developer with their DLC policy is ridiculous.

BUT!!!...

This game to me reminds me of games people would refer to as "Diablo Clones" Essentially any company with enough resources looks at Diablo, changes 1 or 2 elements and releases a game that either is unique or broken. If you look at battle of Empires in the same way, a slightly less impressive or well put together Men of War it is perfectly fine.

I honestly can't complain about it. It IS a game, It does function and do a few things different then Men of War. And I did enjoy it, and I find it hard to not recommend games that I enjoy and do what they should out of the box

author: {'steamid': '76561197989290281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 3671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3671, 'last_played': 1505766454}
review:
https://youtu.be/WTYHyFeiqek

Despite the hours I have played this game for, it is fair to say this game does have a lot of rough edges. The voice acting for one is especially dire.

So in typical MoW fashion you can control all manner of troops, guns and tanks as well as the inventory managment down to individual soldiers. The mpas as ever are quite large and detailed and pretty much everything is destructible. And whilst the graphics, animations and sound are all pretty decent, the game is bugged with the same issues as other games in the men of war series. 

Mainly pathfinding and AI issues. So yes the enemy AI on a field gun will still wreck your tanks with out any problem, your own AI manages to miss enemy tanks even when the directtly in front of them. And yes trying to get your soldiers from A to B is like herding cats. And yes there are times when you will need to save scum like mad to achieve certain objectives. 

Other frustrations include trying to build defenses and squad managment. Well bascially there is no real squad managment as things tend to go south pretty quickly leaving you with troops and odd units all over the maps. Same with defense building there is simply not enough time to ever really utilise the tools given effecttivly.

The game also suffers from some technical bugs such as campaigns that cannot be completed, or sometmes events not triggering until you reload and replay the mission a few times. 

So basically if your a sucker for punishment like me and you like the MoW series, and linterested in the WW1 setting then this is worth a look. And if you buy the full deluxe version then you do at least get a lot of campaigns for the money (if they don't bug out). If your on the fence I really recommend waiting for a steam sale. 

If you don't like the MoW series then this will not change your mind. It will just remind you why you hate those games in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002535250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1503856709}
review:
If you want a good WW1 strategy game, I can recommend two mods that do it much better than this:

1. [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/314420/The_Great_War_1918/]Company of Heroes - The Great War 1918[/url]
2. [url=http://www.moddb.com/mods/the-great-war-mod]Napoleon: Total War - The Great War mod[/url]

After seeing some YouTube footage I thought this game would be like Company of Heroes, but in the trenches of WW1 - I was sorely mistaken. Unlike COH, your troops have little/no AI whatesoever. The pathfinding is just as unreliable as it was in Men of War (the engine it's based on) and, when coupled with the unintuitive interface, it means a lot of micromanagement.

I found this game to be less "strategy" and more babysitting groups of units who won't get into cover properly, or flat-out refuse to shoot at enemies. Let's not also forget the cringeworthy voice acting and the generic placeholder music.

It's a shame beacuse I wanted to like this game. There isn't many good WW1 real-time strategy games out there. Even if you ignore the extortionate price tag (milking the DLC cow dry), this game just isn't that good. It's not even worth getting on sale.

[b]Verdict:[/b] 3/10 - They should have used a different game engine.

review: Though the real price of the game is at least ¬£10 or for everything ¬£26, it is a game which is worth it if you played men of war or like games similar to it. The game once completed will have all major faction campaigns (Austro-Hungary Empire is coming out soon). Another thing is, you have the abillity of picking indivual soldiers out of a huge battle, and allow them to pick up items such as shells, guns, helmets and such, while commanding over 150 soldiers, artillery and tanks. In conclusion a worthy game, even if the price tag is a bit hefty.

review:
If you get the game with all the DLC there's literally more than 100 hours of single player gameplay but the game feel like a mod at the start but if you play through the entire campaign there's a well-made game here.

but overall ignore the fact that it was a mod originally made for the original man of war that became a standalone game. 

It is well made at the end but not at the start. also if you're looking to play multiplayer look elsewhere unless you have a friend that have the game to play with. as it is very hard to get a match in multiplayer.

I had finished the French campaign that took me 15 hours when I finish it. it was a well-made campaign I'm looking forward to finish the rest and I will update this review possibly with a video review here: https://www.youtube.com/user/blackwolfone1

author: {'steamid': '76561198065931408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1498939083}
review: This standalone doesn't hold a candle to Men of War: Assault Squad 2, at all. It's like Men of War: Vietnam. Great idea, but no content and no worth to play. I mentioned in the Skirmish DLC review that they should just let the WWI mod go back up for Assault Squad 2, because this is bare bones, contentless waste of money. Glad I got all the DLC included, because they really add nothing to the game. Multiplayer is beyond dead and there's no capture zones with AI to play against, what I spend most of my time playing in MoW: AS2. Do not buy, unless you want a bare bones with the marrow sucked out with little to no content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098209856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1694803401}
review:
Pros:
1 9 1 4 - 1 9 1 8
A E S T H E T I C C 
Gun Jesus would approve

Cons: clunky controls and AI
not a super value, even when on sale

I've seen lots of negative reviews about this game, claiming that it's buggy and doesn't work or isn't fun. Horse s(hit). I've played this game on a crappy $250 laptop and it plays well with out any hangups. Maybe it's a fluke, maybe it's Maybelline. I have fun but I'm also easily entertained. 

Units are a little clunky. I tell them to run in the trench to another section within the trench and they'll climb out over-the-top and run parallel to the trench. They get shot to s(hit). So you will need to micromanage everything if you want your dudes to survive. 


Now, In the negative reviews, I've seen people talk about how the devs made it a cash grab. I have to agree, despite mostly enjoying the game, I hate to see this kind of stuff in the industry. I think I bought the game and all the DLC about a year ago for $15. Not terrible but not a hot deal, especially with the $30.00 regular price.

It's just too much to pay for what you get and the controls aren't as smooth as say, Company of Heroes or Men of War. But because it's basically a standalone WWI version of those games, I definitely recomend it. Buy it only on sale, and only if you love Gun Jesus and have accepted Him into your 8mm chamber and if you absolutely have to have that 

1 9 1 4 - 1 9 1 8
A E S T H E T I C C


Edit: all that, but I found the Great War Mod for MOWAS2 so fuck this game 

kek

e o fato do jogo ser de visao ligeiramente livre ou seja voce nao joga em terceira nem primeira pessoa e sim numa vis√£o meio isom√©trica, n√£o favorece muito o stealth.

Outra coisa, a intelig√™ncia artificial √© meio ruim cara, na √∫ltima fase da campanha francesa eu consegui fazer com que meu ex√©rcito matar todos os inimigos alem√£es na fase so sobrou um no final do mapa que estava em uma posi√ß√£o inating√≠vel, foi tanque pra tentar matar o cara o tanque n√£o consegue atirar onde o cara t√°, os operadores do tanque n√£o conseguem jogar granada onde o cara t√°, e nem atirar e nem no modo onde voc√™ controla o soldado voc√™ consegue atirar nele.
Resultado. Eu tive que reiniciar a fase do zero.
