author: {'steamid': '76561198026665976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1450893828}
review:
I really wanted to like this game.  I think the Great War is a section of history that has been passed up quite a bit, and an RTS looked like the perfect way to do this.

This game doesn't do a very good job.

Not counting the fact that literally half of the game is DLC, Battle of Empires does not present a good portrayal of the Great War.  It feels too clean, and nothing feels like it has any impact.  Artillery is weak, compared to the absolutely devastating thing it actually was.  Machine guns have trouble cutting down the swaths of soldiers that come at them.  It doesn't feel like the First World War.  And gameplay wise, it's pretty boring.  It's pretty much exactly Men of War, just in WWI.

Also the voice acting is absolutely horrendous.  You couldn't find anyone to give a half-decent impression of a Russian soldier?

I guess I'll have to wait for another WWI RTS to show up and see if it piques my interest without disappointing me like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030037132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2751, 'last_played': 1636662418}
review:
Bought this game in early-access because I'm a big fan of this period and I haven't been so let down since Aliens: Colonial Marines came out. What I thought would be an interesting RTS turned out to be little more than an expensive mod for AS2. I have three main problems with this game:

1) The campaign, which is 95% of the reason I bought this game since multiplayer is terrible and there isnt a 'fight against AI' option is terrible for the amount you pay. The levels are poorly done and very often what should be interesting and exciting campaigns become repetitive and dull. Some battles, like the Marne in the French campaign are great, but seriously who wants to spend two missions helping a handful of Russian officers evade small patrols of Germans and *spoiler alert* spend a mission hiding a flag? Where is the Battle of Tannenberg? Stalluponen? The Battles of the Masurian Lakes? A lot of missions are poorly scripted too, voices don't kick in when they're supposed to or cutscenes activate when they shouldn't- a good example of this was in the Ivangorod mission where in the middle of a fierce firefight the game loaded a cutscene out of the blue. This cutscene involved several soldiers being attacked and shot down by germans whilst they continued to have a calm conversation about what they'll do when the war ends.

2) The voice acting is terrible. And I mean terrible. When I bought this game the French soldiers had a strong Eastern European accent, which I could forgive because it was early days and they'd obviously patch it later.  Which they did, to my horror. When I next loaded the game, their accents had been replaced by British ones- trust me when you hear soldiers using french slang in thick london accents you can't help but laugh. The voices are as awful as the unit animations. The Russian accents are pretty good, but thats all the praise I have.

3) The DLC is getting out of control. I payed for the early-access with the promise of German and British campaigns, as well as the ones that came with it. And once again I got shafted. Do they seriously expect me to pay a tenner to get what they offered me when I payed for this game? Ten pounds for two more campaigns of bad accents, dull missions and more inevitable soul-crushing frustration at what I've become by buying their goddamn DLC. Seriously this has to stop- it's like paying for a sandwich to be told that the fillings will cost you the same price again. If they hadn't demanded more money via DLC, I could have even forgiven some of the other faults.

tl;dr Poor scripting, bad cutscenes, doesn't bring anything new, poor animations, overpriced DLC, don't waste your money

review:
Its a good game overall, and I realise the "omg its got so much dlc." The fact is, its better than things like microsoft flight sim or anything like that, it also has some great mods, with great authors. and YES, I realise the engine isnt good for world war 1. thats something I agree with.


GAMEPLAY

5/10 it gets repetitive after awhile, but overall, fun. not as much grimy warfare as you would suspect

CAMPAINS (did I spell that right?)

8.5/10 This game has AMAZING campains, something worth paying for.

MULTIPLAYER

9/10 although it might seem the game has no playerbase, its got a HUGE one. the only reason I have it under 9/10 is because it has peak-hours around mid-morning until 9-10:00pm

OVERALL

9.5/10 Its a good game, and take perspective. the game is good, but, it could have some improvments, See you in the trenches!

review: Wait so i baught the game early expecting a decent game with the countries and their campaigns included then it released with like one campaign so i figured id come back to it once they actually got set up only to find i now have to pay for the rest of the game? which was all supposed to be there anyway in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064917120', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1468262095}
review:
The game... Oh... THIS game... I honestly don't know what to say, or where to start.

This game was doomed from the start. Really. You pulled an EA, and made us pay for a mod, yes, a mod. Cheers to you all for competing with the mods from AS:2 (Which are basicly this but for free, if you have AS:2) but slapping a big 'ol "PAY US YOUR MONEY" for the game. Alright, thats understandable. You need money to pay it, so we bought it.

So I bought your game. Turns out, the game actually was not mine, in fact I did not buy a game. What I did was basicly buy a broken car that had it's engine ripped out and tires replaced with cubes, and the frame smashed by a 40 ton tank. Then the dealer tells you that you need to give him MORE money for him to fix it, but once you do that he wants to tax you for extra, and then rips out half of that car for himself, and you need to buy THAT part now. Needs a lot of work on it doesnt it? 

Thats basicly this game. You buy a half finished game, the developers pull out CORE parts of it. Campaign? Nope, pay us money. If you don't buy the season pass (35 bucks I think) you end up paying EIGHT DOLLARS FOR EACH Campaign. That doesnt sound bad, but what about the multiplayer? HAHAHHA- No. In fact, recently they TOOK OUT TANKS (Which were previously FREE) and now you have to pay for THEM TO (Which I am pretty sure has to break a steam rule somewhere)

So all in all, why do I not reccomend this game? The Developers have gotten EXTREMELY greedy, to the point where they pull out CORE parts of the game and make you pay yet MORE money to get what SHOULD HAVE BEEN IN THE GAME to start with. I would not be suprised if they eventually made us pay money to play as factions in multiplayer, or use special units. Basicly, they pulled an EA.

And don't get me started with the content you do get for all of that money (Sadly I learned the hard way) You basicly can expect bland combat with linear missions. The multiplayer is HILLARIOUSLY unbalanced and buggy. Gas is almost never used, artillery is laughably useless and expensive, and infantry are aparently as blind as a bat without ears (They cant shoot 5 feet in front of them) which end up being one shotted by a tank across the map, which you can ONLY counter by other tanks (Which is a basicly a big "FUCK YOU" to the russian faction")

author: {'steamid': '76561198071396512', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2925, 'last_played': 1501698860}
review:
Beim releas dieses Spieles hab ich es mir sofort gekauft. Zuerst war zwar nur die Franz√∂sische Kampagne spielbar aber es hat trotzdem Spass gemacht, denn da war noch der Multiplayer der mit der Zeit immer mehr gespielt wurde und dann aber immer weniger, was Schade war.
NAch dem Release haben die Entwickler sehr viele versrechen gemacht wie zum Beispiel die rusische Kampagne zu machen, deutsche sowohl britische. ALs die rusische dann schliesslich in einem Patch ins Spiel kam war sie dann auch nicht gerade die beste.
So habe ich dieses Spiel seit √ºber einem Viertel Jahr nicht mehr gespielt, bis aufeinmal als ich Strategie Spiele im Steam-Store gesucht habe und ich sah ein neues DLC f√ºr dieses Spiel. Doch das was ich sah war schlimm. Man kann jetzt zwar den Multiplayer einzel kaufen der kaum gespielt wird oder man kauft sich die Vollversion UND MUSS SICH DIE KAMPAGNEN ALS DLC DAZUKAUFEN!!!!! WTF.
Ich habe die Rusische und Franz√∂sische Kampagne zwar noch und alle anderen DlCs die mal Kostenlos waren, aber das dieses Spiel einen solch grossen Fehler macht und das nicht einmal nach einem releas Jahr ist einfach nur Traurig. :'(
F√ºr mich ist dieses Spiel denke ich Leider zum gr√∂ssten Teil gestorben, wegen des geizes der Entwickler

author: {'steamid': '76561197990134437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2910, 'last_played': 1522429024}
review:
Originally a mod for the old Men of War, the devs of MOW decided to give these guys some help, and here we are.  While the DLC packs are a bit iffy, the game iteself is still fun.  Nothing like driving an old mkIV tank around, and suddenly it blows up because a German looked at it funny.

Fair warning, there is micro management carried over from MoW.  Annoying for those of us who just want to send things to die, but not overly problematic.  The singleplayer can be a bit buggy from time to time, so if you want to play around in the Gem editor, by all means.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026553139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1601838417}
review:
A poorly developed and disregarded game that has had its greed overvalue the quality of the game.

To begin with the game has horrible voicing of units as well as for the AI being awful, was playing the Austro-Hungrian Campagin and for some reason when attempting to save the soilders left behind they were shouting non stop "Granate" while prone. As well as the developers deceiding to sell the campagins as DLC is a attempt to boost sales and is not even worth the price for such a uninspiring and waste of time that it is.

Also the game has a terrible and buggy control which for some reason isn't responseive.

Furthermore the horses for one instead of riding are simply surfing along which is just stupid like you add horses and they don't even move properly instead surfing around.

Also scripting for the missions is terrible the lines in cutsceenes overlap each other as well as voice actors not even trying at that point.

The only good thing I can say about the game is that is unique not having many WW1 rts game although this is short sighted and has resulted in a terrible game that I had high hopes for, instead a mess and disregarded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012538253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1447807166}
review: When this first came out, I quiet liked it. It was a basic copy of the MoW series games, but it was still fun nonetheless. The voice acting was hillariously bad, but trench warfare and destroying the Hun!! Then just ever so recently I wanted to start playing it again. Buying it ages ago, I thought it would have been updated by now, with some new content, fixes, maps etc. Well, I was right....in a way... Checked out the DLC store to see what paid stuff there was for this because I would have liked to get all the achievements, and as Lana Kane says in Archer, "Nnnnoooooopppeeeee!" $30 for the rest of the Single Player? Are you kidding me? $15 for the Season Pass??? To say I was stunned is an understatement! It's just so sad to think that Best Way Soft has gone the way of Electronic Arts, and is charging a premium price for a product that should have been implemented into the core of the game as a patch (much like the Russian Campaign was at the beginning). They might as well be charging us $100 for HD horse d**k!

review:
This game unfortunately does not capture what could be expected from a ww1 game. Artillery is very weak, the large scale human slaugher and hell on earth is truly encaptured.

As for the DLC, this is exactly what the current trend of DLC slicing leads to. A game which has been dissected and dismembered to me sold as small components instead of a full game. 

It is quite a shame really, this game showed great promise. Additionally, it is an often under-represented part of history in gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074124785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1541980302}
review:
SEASON PASS AWWW YEEEH,  worse than COH2 DLC. I don't care how good the product is. This DLC is insane. And so is every Men of war title that is coming out. DLC DLC DLC.

Battle of Empires, Men of war AS2 , Men of war AS1,  and all these mods that are becoming full games and expect $30 for a few models and weps with tanks (Tweaking   USING THE SAME ENGINE!  (Ahem : Gates to hell, Call to arms, Battle of empires.)    

Reminds me of paid mods like Skyrim.

Stick to AS2 and find some mods that are similar and won't charge you $100 in DLC. An actual modding community won't charge you money for half the mod or to greenlight the mod just to sell it for $30

Edit: They also Censor/ban you on the forums if you complain and just call you wrong without anything backing it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033747596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17455, 'last_played': 1510529289}
review:
Clearly the best WW1 strategy game out there even though it is made by a relativly small dev group. It has a lot of detail, historical accurancy (for a game) and really nice possibilities using the gem editor. Multiplayer is fun and the campaigns are rich of detail although there are too much sneaky missions for my taste. 
Graphics are ok. They could be better but the gameplay is great so it's ok.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014744708', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1511297201}
review: I'd give this game a neutral if i could, Dont get me wrong, its a good game but as many have said it feels more like a dlc or mod than an actual game. I dont no if others suffer with the problem i find the charactor controlled players are a bit... stupid i.e the just stand the and dont shoot esapecially vehicals.  They dont engage [manouver, turn etc] to the enemy and when they do half of the time get  them self stuck. I have to constantly take control of the vehical its self and move and direct its action which is very time consuming, specially when theres more than one vehical in a battle and in many cases for me anyway many lost battles. The soldiers most of the time dont fire back unless extremly close... e.g beyonet close and machine guns and arty are ridculously accurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062917588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1460138052}
review:
it's a great game with a good singeplayer and an derpy and cool multiplayer. i would advize buying in bulk (with friends) but anyways it's great. it does have alot of broken things or more so barely working featurs like horses but still.

Pros:
- Good time line('s)
- strategy isn't required to win but it's great how strategies and counters do work. and you really make your own game!
- looks great
- nasty weapons

cons:
- limited small arms (also relevant to teh time line but still)
- to historicaly accurate unit wise.(couls use a bit more prototype weapons.)
- you unit's ai is shit and respons time to commands and situations is shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017681447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1439399546}
review: This is a very sad moment, the first time I feel the need to not recommend a game!  The reasons which you may or may not agree with. Firstly I believed I was purchasing a game of equal magnitude to MOW with a WW1 theme, I don't generally like to compare but this game had many elements which I find MOW brilliant but soon found out it doesn‚Äôt. I can put up with terrible voice acting and poor story line MOW is no COH but it had a much deeper gameplay, this game has neither. I can understand selling DLC‚Äôs to make extra revenue (business is business), but this was misleading at early access and stating more campaigns to follow once fully released doesn‚Äôt necessarily equate to being charged for them (if your backing a game before pre-release), I will never make that mistake again with any game or company. Lastly I wanted a strategy game, massed soldiers charging across trenches by the bucket loads, choosing to have 1 tank or 5 infantry squads with my limited RTS resource points (whatever they may be called) this fails badly on both. To continue more than half the campaign missions ended up being control 1-5 men sneaking around (if I wanted that style of game I‚Äôd get a FPS style nor a RTS), I don‚Äôt mind 1-2 missions of that style just to break the mould but not that many! Then when I do get a RTS style game the choices I can make on what I field are extremely limited, to in some cases non-existent. Lastly some missions are seriously glitched just check the discussions pages for instances and work arounds (some of which may have been fixed since I played last but I‚Äôm not wasting any more time on it). You may disagree and that‚Äôs your choice but for me this game was a terrible let down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108236684', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 12796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7515, 'last_played': 1663346117}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028650165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3337, 'last_played': 1667449750}
review: This was my first game that I bought that used the gem engine. At first by glance I was a bit skeptical, especially buying it during early access. However over the bad voice acting and weird actions of my units with bugs, I enjoyed and keep will keep on enjoying this game. The editor was confusing for me at first, but after a few tutorial videos, I had my self some long needed fun with massive battles. Overall this game is a 7/10. Because I don't like that they're making the other future campaigns such as the English or German campaign a paid one. I believe the base 4 campaigns should be included and let the paid DLCs only be like minor factions such as US campaign or Italian campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161661130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1445647718}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014394800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2022, 'last_played': 1555793620}
review:
I'm finally gonna make my review on this sinking ship. 

I loved the idea when this was a mod and I still followed it when it became a greenlit game. It is a fun and enjoyable experience at first but the gamemodes make little sence and get quickly boring if you're not playing with a very very good friend of yours. The gamemodes are not at all what you would expect and are really shitty when you take it in as a whole. 
Cooperative could possibly be the only fun you can have for the duration of the campain but there is where we hit another problem.

Selling the SP missions as DLC really does it for me. Not only is the game lacking in content (It got the basics set.) but not being able to see what the devs have to show for is really disturbing when greeted by such a nauseating pricetag. Sounds are not great either which makes the super pricetag just a dealbreaker. 

I have had a good good time playing this game when it was first released here on steam and I was actually looking forward to things. But now I'm just going to let it sink into the void and stop recomending the game for friends and mow players in general.

"Battle of Empires :1914-1918 is a story driven RTS, that re-lives some of the bloodiest battles of ‚ÄúThe Great War‚Äù."
If you have the money to spend sure. I did and was severely dissapointed.
"The graphics have been developed to show the beauty and horrors of ‚ÄúThe Great War‚Äù. "
Poor vissuals and awful sounds makes this beauty and horrors of "The Great War" send real shivers down your spine and not in an exciting way. 

3/10 because they added a Multiplayer-only for a low pricetag. Hell I got the game for 14 eu and that was high enough for this piece crap. -RuNNoLa

author: {'steamid': '76561198018759339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3063, 'last_played': 1676321098}
review:
Yeah I think all of you know the rest when I say you buy this game for 15 dollars a year ago under pre-release stage, with the premise that youll get the full game in the end, but naw. They decied to give you the middle finger and say you have to pay for the rest of the game for it to be full... *clap clap* marketing scumbagship 101. Also by the fact that nearly the entirity of the voice acting is amature at best and comepletely done in broken english with no effort for actually getting national language accents right. The fucking french sound slavic and the only ones who have the best voice acting is the russian campain, which of course, is slavic so it fits. And did i mention the Russian campaign is the longest and most fleshed out ever since the only campaign was France? The France campaign is bare bones, and needs alot more to it to actually be considered even with the other campaigns.

That, and just about every mission needs to start with a stealth mission that sometimes dosnt make a ton of sence at all... Im not gonna lie, these guys could have made a very good WW1 based stratgey game, but naw. Not after practically reskining a free mod you can download right now for Men of War Assualt Squad, not after being a little of what i think is slavic bias and putting waaay more tone into the Russian Empire Campaign, not getting accents on the ball for a fitting atmosphere, and certianly not after cheating out many buyers for the base game in its pre-release stage under the premise that they would get it in full when its done... just no. 

Save your money, and leave these theiving scumbags to know what happens when you turn your back on early stage supporters and to steal their money practically in a gamble for what you hope is a decent campaign with no clear details on its features or just how long and satisfying its going to be... Just stay away from this heap of crap...

review:
[EDIT: Added 'thieving' in front of most of the slur pointed towards the developers... why? THEY ASKED FOR IT!!]

Ashamed I ever bought this copy-paste garbage from thieving ukrainian developers...
Their website clearly stated a while back, that upon purchasing "BoE 1914-1918" you'd get a game alike men of war, featuring 4 campaigns: The Russian, The British, The French and the German...

Did I mention they're thieves?

My friend and I bought the full game during early access after reading their entire website through thoroughly.
Then these thieving dirty lowlife scumbag ukrainians all of a sudden became greedier (and more thieving) than usual, and the agenda changed;
   I had no longer supported the developers of an early access game, expecting the full game upon release... NO... The term "pre-release season pass" spawned alongside this ratpack of thief-developers, and I now - in spite of being promised a decent quality game alike MOW featuring 4 complete campaigns (which I paid for), I'm instead left with 2 poorly crafted campaigns with such horrible voice acting I litterally get a headache after listening to some east-european accent spitting into a tin-can microphone, meanwhile they now expect me to cash out again, to recieve the final 2 campaigns which were in fact part of the deal when I purchased this game... Well no fricking way, you thieving vermin!

If any players out there know how to file a report on either a game or their developers, for abusive money-grabbing and scamming the majority of their paying customers (or something down that alley), I'd appriciate to hear from you.

(May you forever have nightmares about russians and I, you worthless waste of resources.)

(I don't even have to give you the rant about how the removed tanks from the core gameplay, only to include it in DLCs... DLCs which I currently don't own, yet have i earned the achievements from tank-missions during the alpha.. yep, they WERE there.)
developer_response:
We are very sorry that you didn't get what you expect. But, notice, that in description to Battle of Empires, when the game was in Steam Early Access, we are absolutely understandable and clearly explained what will be in this game. We never told that in final version will be 4 campaigns and it will be available for all customers, who bought the game in Steam Early Access. Please, check our detailed response here in this topic.
http://steamcommunity.com/app/316430/discussions/0/530646080863535492/

author: {'steamid': '76561197971139116', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1536349317}
review:
Now I do like this game, it has huge potential. Voice acting is dire, almost beyond comical. Remember the husky officer of Men of war who was almost shouting when he spoke. Yes that bad. But if you overlook that it has the makings of a good game. It is easy to sit here and completey rubbish a game. Without considering how much effort has gone into getting it to the stage it is at. If you play Men of War, Assault Squad one and two. You will be familiar with the interface and the control system it is almost exactly the same. The units and vehicles, in my opinion need a little bit of work as do the maps. 

However that aside it is still perfectly playable and superbly stable in MP (no OOS errors). I have only played 4 of the campaign with mates so far and we had a blast. Some of the maps really seemed to tax my system (large infantry charges etc so I think the game needs a bit of optimisation as I wasn't running it with all the shiny bits on full. Although my rig is coming up to 4 years old the components are of a high end quality and I can still play a lot of premium titles with high to ultra settings (mainly textures etc) with decent steady frames.

I got a little bored of this quite quickly though and I think that is down to the final polish of the game. Plus I do jump from game to game and have a flavour of the week then jump back to games. There are errors within the game which where quite obvious. But not game breaking. The devs are very responsive to the discussions forum and are keen to respond to your queries and suggestions. 

I would recommend this game as it really is refreshing to see a WWI title as opposed to the very obvious WWII stuff. I'm not 100% how historically accurate the game is, it depends if that is your bag or not. I would recommend it if you are in the market for a fun RTS with a different slot in history.

review:
Battle of empires: 1914-1918 est un jeu tr√®s r√©ussi de strat√©gie en temps r√©el sur la premi√®re guerre mondiale, on peut dire qu'il est tr√®s int√©ressant, m√™me si l'IA est parfois encore un peu d√©bile, il peut avoir des rares √©clairs de g√©nie (en somme, assez rare mais √† not√©!). Il a l'air historiquement assez fiable, les graphismes sont pas mal r√©ussi, il est agr√©able √† jouer sans √™tre exceptionnel. Est-ce qu'il vaut 20 euros? Je ne sais pas, j'en doute car je pense que sa dur√©e de vie est limit√©e et que seulement deux campes √ßa reste trop peu, les 4 campagnes pour 20 euros (Britannique et Allemand en pr√©paration) mais l√† j'ai l'impression d'acheter un jeu en kit et de pas encore avoir tout malgr√© que la premi√®re partie est d√©j√† pas mal et que c'est pas non plus les sims niveau jeu en kit.

Ce jeu, on y joue strat√©gie et on y passe du bon temps! Qu'est ce que le peuple demande de plus? Il y a des jeux, il ne lui manque que du pain!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023240895', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 59634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1654813172}
review:
pros:An excelent modding comunity with a many great mods.
        A good world war 1 game which simulates many of the weapons and tactics of the war.
        A very good campaign like the MOW orginal.
        A very good feature which allows you to subscribe to mods automaticaly when you join a modded server.
        Very good DLCs which offer things like new campaigns and a chance to play Word war 2 reviving the Men of war   original (free dlc victory pack).
        An excellent and lively community and a very good multiplayer which is free of out of syncs and bugs.    

 cons:A very bad presantation of horses (trying to cavalry charge the enemy will result in a pile of death horses
          Some WWI features like gas attacks and stuff are missing for the game,however there are many mods who fix things like this.

Overall i would recommend this game for any player who wants a good world war 1 strategy game and wants a good sequel to the men of war original.However this game is still undergoing developing so many things are prone to change to better (or to worse).

9/10 would kill an army of horses again

review:
My bad but I did not realize this purchase was MULTI-PLAYER ONLY!  You get to play only the training and 1st mission.  And that was PAINFUL.  Loading a canon should be automic when you put soldiers on it.   I spent hours trying to get through the basic training mission.  First time it wanted me to emliinate the enemmy from the town.  No enemy.  No red dots.  Loading the canon is like a riddle ffs.  Do this, stand on your head, finger in your ear and press the x key.  WTF!  

Then you have the multi-player.  Only 3 available games and they are locked an russion ffs.  I'm done with this series.  Red Tide was a fiasco. Impossible to win.  AMF!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065238570', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1912, 'last_played': 1464217445}
review:
Honestly, no I cannot recommend this game. The editor is crazy broken, with 25% of the models crashing the game and causing you to loose all progress you made on your map/mission, furthermore they are milking the game for all it's worth, forcing you to pay extra for all campaigns when the game only comes with one short campaign. The 3 campaigns ( 2 of which have a high chance to randomly crash ) are only available when purchased for a total of $26.97, meaning this buggy mess of a MOD (and yes that's all it is) is $46.96. Let's look at other Men of War in comparison.  Men of War Assault Squad 2 is $34.99 for the deluxe edition and includes 5 campaigns, Men of War Assault Squad 1 is $15 for the "Game of the Year Edition" and includes 5 campaigns with and extra 2 missions for each campaign (comes with the DLC) and an extra bonus mission. All of these games are cheaper than this game and a lot better made. Battle of Empires is a mod and expecting there to be better quality when a $47 price tag on it is insane. 

So short answer, no don't buy this game buy one of it's many cheaper cousins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049311372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1461113394}
review:
Definitely not recommended

-Poorly made missions in sometimes terrible maps
-Awful cutscenes, look like a 2000 game
-Terrible, terrible voice acting both in game and cutscenes
-Text translation errors everywhere and voice actors speak terrible english
-Lacks of content, 50% of the game is sold as a separate DLC
-Has many bugs and problems linked to poor AI and troop movement
-Looks like a poorly made reskin of MoW AS

It's a shame, the game idea is nice and the game in itself isn't terrible
but definitely not worth all the money they ask for, maybe 10 euro with all the DLCs included

PS: they will try to bullshit you that separate DLCs is to allow you to buy the pieces you want according to your budget and playstyle or some other bullshit, terrible excuse...they can't even make good ones

developer_response:
[quote=Adnar]another 7 dollars for tanks...and then another 15 for the other campaigns?[/quote]
Wrong!
15 dollars for Blazing guns (Tanks) + British campaign + German campaign.
Single DLC campaigns only for those who won't buy all campaigns.
I.e. you can spend only 5 (mp only game) + 7 (blazign guns DLC) = 12 dollars to feel full mp & single experience. Also editor, workshop items etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096631500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1438113550}
review:
[h1] Gute Idee - Passable Umsetzung [/h1]

[b] Das Spiel ist im momentanen Zustand keinen Kauf wert. Die DLC Politik und die ganze Aufmachung wirken wie pure Geldhascherei. Im Folgenden einmal alle Pro's und Con's auf einen Blick :

Positiv : 

+ originale Filmaufnahmen als Sequenzen
+ tolle Artworks
+ versch. Uniformen aller Nationen
+ Steam Workshop


Negativ : 

- extrem doofe KI
- grausame DLC Politik (Panzer nur per DLC)
- nur 2 Kampagnen kostenlos spielbar
- Grafik √§hnlich wie MoW 1 (wurde auch als Mod gestartet, dennoch echt mies)
- deutsche Sprachaufnahmen sehr amateurhaft (schlechte Qualit√§t)
- eine Menge √úbersetzungsfehler 
- f√ºr den Umfang zu teuer
- wirkt wie ein Early Access Spiel

Zum Zeitpunkt Ende Juli 2015 kann ich dieses Spiel nicht empfehlen. Es ist wenig abwechslungsreich, nicht wirklich dynamisch und die doofe KI verleitet zu Wutanf√§llen. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048209509', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1516518934}
review: Selling TANKS for 7 dollars? Are you insane? Should not be DLC, I played this game before it was fully released and we had tanks, not to mention, any modder could make some tank missions. Also, selling campaigns for seperate? I'm sorry, but the people who made this game are MUCH smaller than they think they are to be charging such prices for such things, they're not EA or some big company where their cashgrabs often seem not to matter, this can kill small games. The actual game is decent, but it is like a mod for Men of War: Assault Squad. Trouble is, this WAS a mod, however it seems the biggest change they've made is putting much of their content behind paywalls. Shame on the developers of this game. Their game is not worth 20 dollars, plus 7 dollars, plus 10 plus 10. They are stacking DLCs that should be included in a game not worth 30 dollars trying to make it worth 60 or 70.
developer_response:
We have provided a flexible purchasing system that allows you to choose the optimal configuration of BoE, at a reasonable price according to your play style and budget.

This allows you to enhance the game with additional content by purchasing DLC‚Äôs individually, or as a package.

1) The Basic Package(Battle of Empires: 1914-1918 - base price $19.99) includes:
- Training missions (2 missions)
- French Campaign (8 missions)
- Russian Empire Campaign (10 missions)
- Mutliplayer with MP Pack 1 & MP Pack 2 (4 nations, 7 game modes, skirmish - battles against AI, more than 20 mp maps, ww2 units set and historical reconstruction "Battle of Berlin")
- and Editor. 

All BoE Steam Workshop content is available with this package (you still need to subscribe to workshop content).
-----------------------------------------------------
2) The  Multiplayer package (Battle of Empires 1914-1918: Multiplayer-only - base price $4.99) includes:
- Tutorial missions 
- Mutliplayer MP Pack 1 & MP Pack 2 (4 nations, 7 game modes, more than 20 mp maps, ww2  units set and historical reconstruction "Battle of Berlin")
Basic mp Steam workshop content is available with this package (you still need to subscribe to the workshop content).

Do you still think that this content is not good value for money?

author: {'steamid': '76561198090980099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1437703555}
review: I do enjoy the game. Unfortunatly, a worry of mine was the lag that was interuppting me in a multiyplayer secnario. I didn't know if my computer had the right specifications. A thing that i could reccommend to developers is to add more detail into solider looks and actions. they looked a bit out of sorts to me. Finally, if anybody is a big fan of war games and strategy this game is a good balance of both. But the thing that threw me off when i bought it was that i didn't pay much attention to if it was the newly releaced multiyplayer or singleplayer

author: {'steamid': '76561197970432545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1472296513}
review:
I'd been watching the game make it's way through early access and liked the look of how it was shaping up. So far I've done the basic training and the first couple of missions in the Russian Campaign. I think I've only just scratched the surface of what the game has to offer. 

I've seen a bunch of people complaining about the DLC which is a shame because the Devs have split the game up nicely for those who only want the Multiplayer part of it which I think is pretty neat. The base game is more than enough to say it's money well spent so for me DLC just means more hours of fun so when the next campaign is released I'll be getting the season pass for sure. 

I'd really like to see more games set in WWI and Battle of Empires shows that if it's done right it can work really well.

MP je drobet nevybalancovan√Ω, ale nen√≠ nejlehƒç√≠ vybalancovat hru kter√° se sna≈æ√≠ b√Ωt i realistick√°. A nen√≠ tu ≈æ√°dn√© out of sync, velmi zn√°m√Ω probl√©m v MoW AS2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018460505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1607525086}
review:
This game has improved dramatically since it's inception, and the Multiplayer in particular is absolutely wonderful. That being said, it bothers me that the game doesn't have a "Skirmish" mode so as to try your skills against an A.I enemy.  I think even a sort of "Wave Attack" game mode on the trenches vs A.I would be wonderful. The campaign is in short, awful.. alot of people are going to be annoyed by me saying that but it's simply the truth.  The strength of this game is the entertaining multiplayer, this is magnified if you can find a group of fellow "BoE'ers" to play with regularly. 

8/10 for multiplayer alone. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ALGem_gopxk

author: {'steamid': '76561198010488143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1480501461}
review:
First off, I think a lot of people misunderstand the DLC system for this game, if you buy the full game you get Multiplayer, the French campaign and the Russian campaign. You can chose to buy the game in parts, or you can just pay $20 for the whole thing. 

This game is pretty much MoW with some tweeks, new units ect... If you liked Mow you'll like this, if you didn't you probably won't.  This game does fill a niche of ww1 squad based rts, and it does it very well.  The game is out of early access but still has some issues that are being worked on by the very community involved dev team.

The campaign is a lot of fun, its a true Men of war 1 style campaign with shitty voice actors and all but that is part of the charm. I thought it was pretty cool how you could really see the progression of the war throughout the missions, from cloth hats and fields to steel and trenches.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982078956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1474970401}
review:
Good game overall, similar to Men of War 2 Assault which deals with World War 1, instead of 2.
Micromanage units during small battles with destructable environments.

Initially I gave the game a negative review as it appeared that the developer was charging extra for a working multiplayer.  Now that the title was corrected, I dont have a problem with the game anymore.  The multiplayer version is the game only with a working multiplayer, nothing else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076497336', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3537, 'last_played': 1510328943}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124420177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1469133886}
review:
It was fun at first, and sending waves of copy-pasted soldiers into the meat grinder in the editor is hours of entertainment, but I can't recommend this game just to save others from dissapointment.

I'll start with the elephant in the room, the devs are almost cartoonishly greedy it seems. They've cut the legs off the game to sell to us as DLC. It's analagous to selling someone a car, and then selling them a season pass that includes the rear-view mirror, the trunk door, and the two rear wheels.

Otherwise, the game fails to in any way captre the brutality of the first world war. This is do in part to the failing of the Gem engine to be able to accurately portray this, but nonetheless I expect more to that end from a project of this scale. Trench Warfare was frequently brutal hand to hand combat, but all this seems to depict is lazy potshots at one another from across no mans land. Artillery is frequently so weak it's virtually useless, failing to do any significant damage before the enemy has a chance to bandage themselves. The addition of horses was interesting at a glance, but the soldiers can't do anything from horseback, so attempting to make cavalry charges just results in a lot of dead horses. Hardly spectacular. Gas is rarely used in the campaign, and it's always a cutscene, watching a trenchful of your men just die without any kind of reaction. Nobody puts on the gasmasks that are clearly in their inventory, no body attemtps to run or seek shelther from it. It's like gassing mannequins.

All in all, a very poor depiction of World War One. Look elsewhere.
developer_response:
Thank you for this really useful feedback.
We know that it has already passed for 6 month and still many people blame us for this "cutted legs" for "Battle of Empires".

We understands how it looks, but, really, guys we didn't planned to create a pack of dlcs one by one, just to "steal your money". We will never stop saying - we planned to do only one campaign. On some stage we understood that we have a resources to make 2 campaigns in "Base game". And we decide to do it. In that times we didn't even talked about "base game". We talked about "Battle of Empires". Yes we wanted to give you more nations, more missions, more interesting stories. But we didn't have necessary resources for so huge job. It all depended from your desire. We have only ideas and understanding what we want to give you. After success of BOE we realized that we have the power. We have your great support and you want to recieve that ideas what we have. So we decided to bring these ideas to life. And best format for these ideas it is DLC.
Most of remarks are true in this review. Some of them we could change and we changed them in out updates. Some of them it's thoughts about "how it will be cool" but, for some reasons we didn't implement them into our game. It's because of time, it's because of our resources, after all, it's because this thing  doesn't work well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006914300', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1638935678}
review:
Battle of Empires est un jeu tr√®s prometteur avec plein de promesse et je vais expliquer pourquoi je ne le recommande pourtant pas (cela peut changer) [bah mon *** si tu savais]!

le bon: 
- graphiquement √ßa reste tr√®s correcte sans √™tre fabuleux
- le skin des unit√©s ainsi que l'armement est tr√®s bien respect√©
- la campagne √† une difficult√© variable qui emp√™che l'ennui et elle suit le parcour historique
- la jouabilit√© est simple a prendre en main et elle est assez proche de MoW 2, suffit juste d'une sourie bien quelle puisse un peu manquer de l'utilisation du clavier pour les raccourcis
- une IA bien orchestr√©, qui sait choisir ces cibles et us√© de strat√©gie pour nous abbattre
- le r√©alisme des d√©gats aux unit√©s (exemple, un soldat meurt s'il est touch√© au torse), ainsi que le principe MoW 2 de la gestion de l'inventaire

le mauvais:
- quelques bug rencontr√© quand au suivis des ordres donn√© aux unit√©s qui ont tendance a ne pas bouger ou tirer
- la campagne, a quand m√™me en d√©faut d'√™tre extr√™mement compliqu√© √† certain moment et on ressent le manque de disponibilit√© de ressource (manque de renfort la plupart du temps) ou de possibilit√© de strat√©gie pour vaincre l'ennemi
- la vitesse de jeu (exemple, on a le temps de fum√© 2 clopes ou plus le temps que les chars bougent d'un point A √† B), ce qui casse le rythme de la bataille

Peu de mauvais en effet pour ce jeu mais il y a surtout les grosses d√©ception, sachant que je l'ai achet√© en early acces!!

d√©ception:
- 1 mission cot√© fran√ßais sur la bataille de Verdun (les tranch√©s quoi!), UNE F..... mission qui relate la plus longue et la plus interressante partie de la guerre 14-18; c'est du foutage de gueule sachant que cela a dur√© plusieur mois (3 ans si je ne m'abuse) et qu'il y a eu de tr√®s nombreuses batailles historique et d√©cisive! De quoi rallonger √©norm√©ment la dur√©e de vie de ce jeu
- la promesse faite par les d√©veloppeurs d'avoir dans la version fini une campagne pour chaque faction (donc 4 puisque les am√©ricans font partie du Commonwealth sauf changement) est un gros fake, le jeu est "fini" depuis peu et on se retrouve d√©j√† avec un DLC pour la campagne allemande, c'est un gros doigt en l'air pour les joueurs; certe les DLC sont √† la mode en ce moment mais merde tenez parole!!!
- toujours sur les DLC, en avoir, oui! mais pas sur vos promesses, plutot sur plus de contenu comme la possiblit√© de jouer une autre faction (italie, empire ottoman?) ou de revivre certaines batailles ou campagnes bien particuli√®re

Pour conclure, bien que ce jeu soit vraiment bien sur plusieur point, on ressent le besoin de toujours faire plus de pognons sur le dos des joueurs et je ne le recommanderai donc pas a d'autre!
On demandait pas beaucoup, voir m√™me rien puisqu'on a pas notre mot √† dire pendant le d√©veloppement mais simplement que les d√©veloppeurs tiennent les engagement qu'ils ont eux-m√™me exig√© et dont ils nous on fait part lors de l'early acces!

PS: je n'√©nonce pas le multijoueur car je n'ai pas encore essay√©

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Je met √† jour ce post apr√®s plusieurs ann√©e!
C'est un immense pouce rouge pour ce jeu!!
Nous sommes en d√©cembre 2021 et rien, je dis bien rien, n'a chang√© dans le jeu...
Je souhaitais m'y replong√© et bien non gros d√©go√ªts apr√®s avoir juste √©t√© dans le menu et d√©marr√© une partie.
Et le pire de cette vaste ******** blague? Je viens de voir que les campagnes de base du jeu c-√†-d la France et la Russie et bien elle sont payante maintenant!
Donc les gens qui ach√®te ce jeu, bah vous n'avez rien du tout en vrai XD
Comme sur IL-2 d'ailleurs!? M√™me d√©veloppeur? 

Si vous le voulez, acheter le 1‚Ç¨ symbolique et avec des DLC de campagne √† tout le moins!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029565135', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1545865506}
review:
O jogo √© um Men of War vers√£o Primeira Guerra Mundial, no qual permite tu reviver as batalhas da Grande Guerra de 1914 a 1918.

O jogo em s√≠ √© bastante simples, com apenas 2 campanhas (Fran√ßa e R√∫ssia Tsarista) por√©m isso se deve ao motivo de que os desenvolvedores ainda est√£o criandos novas coisas para o jogo.
Para ser exato, o jogo ainda est√° sendo feito mas mesmo assim ele √© recomend√°vel e est√° em estado jog√°vel.

√â bastante divertido e muitas vezes complicado, acredito que os desenvolvedores deveriam simplificar a campanha dos russos sendo algo bem dificil.

Mesmo assim, eu recomendo o jogo, perfeito para aqueles que gostam de jogos relacionados a hist√≥ria ou Guerras sangrentas, sendo um oficial desses conflitos.

O jogo tem muitas miss√µes, o que torna o jogo cada vez mais competitivo e din√¢mico, junto com √≥timos efeitos especiais e grande variedade de op√ß√µes para melhorar o desempenho da jogabilidade.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042786117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1694, 'last_played': 1547779277}
review:
Das Spiel selber ist nicht √ºbel ,auch wenn einige Missionen noch verbuggt sind . Doch was sich die Entwickler da erlauben ist eine einzige Frechheit , gestartet wurde das Ganze vor einigen Jahren als Mod f√ºr MoW doch dann hie√ü es miteinmal das man daraus ein Steam Greenlight macht ,die Kampagnen aber alle dennoch enthalten sein werden und jetzt BAM ! ...man darf f√ºr die Deutsche und die Britische Kampagne bezahlen ! 
Das ist reine Geldmacherei !

Zu dem witzigen Kerl der meint das Entwickler auch bezahlt werden wollen : Nicht als Modder ! 75% der Inhalte waren schon damals auf Moddb zu sehen ,bevor sie sich entschlossen haben die Geldpresse namens Steam Community anzuwerfen ...und bewusst und mit voller Absicht Inhalte aus dem Spiel zu entfernen und diese als DLC's zu verkaufen ist das hinterletzte ! Insbesondere wenn man diese Inhalte zuvor als im Spiel enthalten angibt und sie erst dann entfernt wenn man merkt das man weniger Geld mit dem Spiel verdient als wie gedacht ...

review:
*NEW EDIT* decided to give the game a chance years later... voice acting is still godawful, as is the level design. the russian encirclement level is literally the WORST single player mission i have ever played in my life.  it is so buggy i am convinced it is impossible to successfully complete. You complete the objective, but then fail that same objective later on in the mission. (eliminate patrols early in game, *do that*, get new objective i.e. hold the village, get notified FAIL: YOU FAILED TO ELIMINATE ENEMY PATROLS.)  The game is a low budget bug-ridden mess. Get it if youre that into WWI and men of war, but for gods sake dont buy it full price. 

Old review: the deadliest thing in the game is the awful voice acting. plus some of the missions are just too damn hard, your squad gets completely wiped out and you get hardly any reenforcements.. so right now i cant recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058907713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3752, 'last_played': 1711135782}
review:
*EDIT: They are now calling it a 'flexible purchasing system'. This is absolute rubbish. They are doing it to receive more money. Money Grabbers.

DLC
DLC
DLC

DO NOT BUY THIS 'GAME':

You have to pay for the British and German campaigns,even if you bought BOE with early access. But with the original Men of War, the German, Russian, British and Bonus missions were not DLC's at all, and were with the base game. This is now only ¬£5. Also, I bought the game in December 2014, and I only get the French and Russian campaign with the early access ( which adds up to 20 missions in total). Then, this 'Blazing Guns' DLC, which has 10 missions I think, comes out today (July 1 2015). This is not for free for people who bought it during Early Access, but for people who bought it between sometime in April to July 1. Also to note, 20 missions was ¬£9.99 when it first came out as early access, but they have increased the price for 40 missions to ¬£23.99. 

I like the gameplay and the editor (which surprisingly comes with the base game), but this 'Flexible Purchasing System' is what really let this 'game' down, and you can just buy Men of War (which uses the same engine) for more than 1/4 of the price of this 'game'

author: {'steamid': '76561198002053619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2063, 'last_played': 1510932425}
review:
- The game uses an older engine, not Assault Squad 2 (That means a few nice features of AS2 will be missing). 
- They tried to add horses to the game ... but engine does not let it do in a decent way - mounted soldiers can't fight. Horses act only as transport, probably because engine does not support a passenger shooting from a vehicle. Not to mention that any melee attack while driving a car disguised as a horse is not possible in Assault Squad engine.
- They did only Russian and French campaigns and British and German campaign will be paid DLC.
- Script and voice acting is terrible. I mean - very terrible.

- The positive is that they have a bit better scenarios for SP than latest Assault Squad 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050158383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1463023090}
review:
BoE in terms of gameplay is nearly identical to the Men of War series. With that said the graphics are enjoyable and the game is well optimized. The voice acting could use a little work but the sound effects (gunshots, expolsions, etc.) are on point. The combat is very engaging (no pun intended), battles usual turn out to be large infantry fire fights with some focus on support weapons. When tanks come into a match, that match becomes a cluster fuck of fun. The game could use more maps for multiplayer and some addition campagins. 

Three things I very much dislike:

-You can't build trenches! I hope the devs fix this because, well...its a WW1 game right?(on the flip side lots of multiplayer maps have a fair amount of trenches)

-Camera shakes when there are expolsions near by! (how am I supposed to focus when my camera is moving in 10 different directions at once? I may have over exaggerated just a bit...but you get the point! XD)

-The AI has the occasional glitch (I tell my infantry man to throw a grenade at the enemy tank from his trench, tank is 5  feet away, walks out of the trench to throw the grenade but gets killed from tank's machine gun, yet he could have easily throwen the grenade from his trench).

OVERALL OPINION: All in all buy the game. The flaws are minor, the battles are epic and has a very "over the top feel". Your money will be spent well, the future looks great for this game! See you on the battlefield!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055656407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1574382035}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026291707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1472829818}
review:
Just in time for opposite day I got my review in. So here goes. I'll start with the good things first, then moving on to the bad.

-The voice acting is absolutely superb. From what I understand they used actors who were actually members of the nationalities they were speaking as. Each mission introduction gives deep insight onto what you're supposed to be doing and you can very easily find yourself getting sucked in by the authenticity of the mission briefing.
-There are always multiplayer games available. I've never had to wait an hour in the lobby without finding a game.
-The graphics are absolutely amazing. I'm running it through a GTX 770 and it can make my computer choke like a dog on the max settings.

Now for the bad.
-The game has no strategy to it. The factions are totally unbalanced and some weapons are way too overpowered. You can basically just spam infantry because machine guns won't cut them down.
-The historical accuracy is way off. The weapons aren't correct for the period and you don't get any kind of historical background on why or how they were used.
-The campaign sucks. The missions are boring and repetitive. No variety really.
-The developers have basicaly abandoned the game, they haven't supported it at all since launch.

P.S. Since some of you will be reading this not on opposite day, just swap the meanings of all my points. If you're into strategy games and/or WWI weapons and tactis, this game is worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014188565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1438305589}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075329676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1443637350}
review:
I'm a fan of the Men Of War series and take an interest in the First World War, so naturally I was drawn to this game like a moth to a flame. For the first 10 hours, I overlooked the atorocious voice acting and the incredibly monotonous music which lacked emotion, out of the sheer excitement this game brought me. Not many First World War games out there, especially which let you experience the Galician campaigns of 1914/1915 and the early war engagements when the conflict still had impetus. 
After the excitement wore off I started questioning for what good reason I paid ¬£18.99 for this game. I got two campaigns from the side of the entente, while I'm ardently waiting to lead the KuK forces against the Russians, and also hopefully the German armed forces into single player missions, the editor makes this possible. I hope the community to save me on this one. 
I understand this is still in its infancy stage, but the general artistic decisions are very dissapointing. The music should completent the atmposhere. It should exacerbate the horrors of mechanised warfare. Yet what I received is something unequivocally not suited to the game. I would easily forgive the bad voice acting, and those god awful stealth segments, if the time period was treated with more respect. I currently see too much focus on tank warfare. For something which came in late war, I would prefer to see more focus on infantry warfare. More fluidity when it comes to trench warfare and to inspire more dynamic engagement would make this game stand out for me. 
I came back to MOWAS recently just to see how much did it change compared to BoE and its generally a far more fluid and enjoyment filled experience. 
Even if I absolutely adore the period, and the remarkable battles which this video game brings to life, I simply cannot reccomend this in its current state.

review:
Enfin un jeu de  strat√©gie en temps r√©el de qualit√© sur la premi√®re guerre mondiale ! Certes, il est encore en d√©veloppement √† l'heure o√π j'√©cris ces quelques lignes et seules les campagnes fran√ßaises et russes sont disponibles, mais c'est d√©j√† un super jeu ! Je le poss√®de d'ailleurs depuis sont lancement sur steam.

-En parlant des campagnes, les developpeurs fournissent un r√©el effort pour coll√© le plus possible √† la r√©alit√© historique sans pour autant faire une simple "relecture historique". 

-Au niveau des graphismes, le jeu est relativement bien r√©alis√©, d'autant plus qu'il s'agit d'un jeu de strat√©gie ! 

-Le mode multijoueur offre des possiblit√©s de batailles tr√®s vari√©es : ligne de front, combat libre, capture de point strat√©gique,etc... Et propose les 4 "grandes nations" du conflit qui sont : France, Royaume-uni, Allemagne et Russie, chacune offrant des unit√©s uniques.


Bref, achetez ce jeu, je vous certifie que vous ne serez pas d√©√ßu !!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037294258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3940, 'last_played': 1446657382}
review: I bought this first day of release.  the game was good at first, but I've been waiting to see how they handle some of the bugs & issues brought up by users before I wrote a review.  So, my review:  EXCELLENT!  I like the Men of War games and don't know as much about WW1, but this game is really fun and has got me looking into more history of WW1.  The small development team has been very responsive to problems that were in the early game and to user requests.  I am having fun with French and German campaigns and looking forward to the Brits and others.  Some of the missions are stealth, and if you don't like those you can simply skip them.   So spend the money and support the great work these folks are doing, and have some fun with WW1.

review:
If you like the Men of War series then you'll like this, using the same engine but set in the First World War. Great work and continuous development plus new and up coming mods for the game.

-Multiplayer activity is rather low, but as time goes on and the game gets more attention I'm sure that will improve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048249173', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2771, 'last_played': 1662407196}
review:
When i bought the game, i thinked it would be like MOWAS2, but after playing it a while, it was well worth it, the game has high detail models, realistic battle's with gas and cannons and machineguns.

And It was intresting finding out that the game gives you a challenge when it comes to Frontline, i found it hard wich endt up with being more stratetic to assault the trenches, first time was really hard due to enemy artillery, and trenched troops gave me hard time. But it was amazing to re-create the battle from WW1, it was not easy in that time to take enemy trench without heavy casulties.

So after my gaming experience with the game. i say this is one of the greatest games i got in my libary.

If you love WW1 and love MOWAS2. BUY THE GAME, You won't regret it

author: {'steamid': '76561198044191081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 6562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4944, 'last_played': 1625286012}
review:
I write this review as this game is only at it's beginning in development. I know with certainty that this game has great potential, since the Men of War fans will thrive in this community due to the familiar interface.

Review Updated: 11/1/2015

Stay away. These developers are greedy. This game also gets old after awihle because there is a small variety of maps and units. Now I understand why so few developers pursue World War One themed games. Something they could have tried here is use the barely existing aircraft ingame for players' advantage. Honestly, I don't think this game is worth the money anymore. The first section of my review really reflects upon how the game was looked upon before it was finally submitted as being completed.

review:
This game has a lot of potential, and has some interesting mechanics.

The translation to English is pretty awful, and the voices are cringe worthy, especially when voicing a drill sergeant. It is on par with "All your base are belong to us" (My favorite so far is, "Get to the cover!")

Also, no checkpoint system is DREADFULLY IRRITATING.

The learning curve seems a bit steep, but the game has a lot to offer, so far...

author: {'steamid': '76561198048777711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1488718253}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013416511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3243, 'last_played': 1453555308}
review:
Great game, had not played this style since commandos, missed the whole men of war, either way this is a tactical dream game. Some pure entertainment in every battle win or lose. The accuracy of the time period is great as well.

The sheer amount of options for each soldier is awesome, some can be getting more ammo, some in trees sniping, some on the charge...great for micro management in one smooth game. 

I will say I spend alot of time in slow motion in this game, almost necessary to cover the action/span the map and still be able to manage active forces in time on many maps.

I dont mind the russian voice acting, personalizes it with the creators which is awesome, they deserve it. Besides, WWI is a bit more symbolic for Russia/Europe than it is for America, perfectly fitting we cater to an honor of theirs for a change.

I would suggest France campaign first. seems to be a much smoother campaign overall, good mix of maps, challenges.

Doing Russia second, and I found some of the narration timing/lengths frustrating, the story line jumps all over, and there are some quirks (pathing ect) that overall made gameplay illogical in some parts, so save often. Still playable, still interesting battles with entertainment every game...just not as smooth and enjoyable as France.

Managed a multiplayer battle once...certainly a new kind of game, in a good way. 

Recommend for certain, glorious heoric deaths and hilarious not so heroic deaths around every corner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027583293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1620911537}

review: Alright lets get started, first off they put way to much weird shit in this game like oh you can control and play every single soldier you have to heal them individually, you have to remember and find the one you need to give ammo too out of like a hundred, but you will want to kill who ever designed the controls for the soldiers, i told my soldiers to run around an artillery position and I did all the proper controls, but first they decided to lay down in front of them and get shelled. Then after i told them to get back up they did but also decided to run backwards then stop turn around and start shooting randomly until they just sort of died. I cannot stress enough how bad of a game this is. And i loveeeeeeeeee strategy games, i would love this game if it wasnt so stupid with its impossible to change camera angles, horrible controls that make me lose the battle i have spent 20 minutes fighting to win. or very vague instructions like hey take the hill... when there are no hills or like 5, defend the field, which one? there are fields everywhere?? You will also want to kill someone because you will spend 10 minutes trying to give an artillery unit the ammo it needs while your being shot at because some weird voodoo witch magic wont let you without some PHD in applied bullshit. Not worth 20 bucks, not even worth 5 bucks. save your money and go buy porn you will get far more hours of enjoyment out of it than with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082107626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1462023870}
review: Battle of Empires : 1914-1918 was a good independant game extracted from the Men of War Series. Something like the DayZ Standalone and Arma 2. It is a challenging game with the classic Men of War Strategy element, warfare and stealth gameplay with a pinch of it's own spices. It has a good storyline and original voice acting but the game is yet to be completed which has saddened me. I look forward for future campaigns, especially the German campaign!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971970754', 'num_games_owned': 883, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1554580247}
review:
I'll be honest, I'm a fan of men of war and that series of games, but I was just unable to find myself enjoying this at all.

While Men of War is a great game, why they used the system for Men of War 1 and not the Assault Squad 2 engine is beyond me, the controls are very clunky and the missions don't really grip me that well in the "wow" factor I found myself in Men of Wars original game.

When playing a Skirmish match and looking at the units I had available....it's not a lot.

A few sets of squads, some support units, a few bits of arty and varying bits of armour support. 

Very underwhelming and personally, not something I felt was worth the ¬£18.99 I spent on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091106280', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1602548499}
review: There is no British, German, Austrian or Ottoman campaign and without those I cannot reccomend this game. While the French and Russian campagins offer variety in missions, unless there is an update with more campaigns I cannot reccomend this game. In terms of gameplay it is similar to Men of War, but it is similar to World War 1 in that artillery and machine guns win battles. The voice acting is quite bad too, but I would not hold off buying the game just because of that. You can also create your own missions so if you really want the game, have experiance with the MOW engine map editor and don't care about playing campaigns then for all means buy it. This reveiw is completly subjective.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973903287', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1567165090}
review:
Kind of glitchy with weird Russians trying to do French accents (It sounds funnier in concept than the reality) and missing animations.

Seriously they need someone to redo all of the voice overs. Hearing a Russian guy pretending to be French trying to pronounce the German word for hunt  (Jaeger) is a nightmare. 

Just for reference Jaeger is pronounced like Yay-Grr not "Jogger". 

However despite those technical issues, there's something still fun to be had within the base gameplay. Is it worth it though?

I'm going to go with yes, but just barely. At least until they put out a German campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006602028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 9715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8634, 'last_played': 1450201945}
review:
As it is now, even before its release, I can already and absolutely recommend you this game.

The reason why is Devs mentality, I trust them, I feel like they listen to their community and every new update brings real new things, every new update is a step forward.

This game was gifted me by the Devs after winning a little competition, and this was already a good start, I really appreciated it, not a thing that happen in many other games, it actually never happened to me before to have a game gifted by some devs.

This game, contrarily to other MOW series titles, it's developed with Realism in mind, uniforms, units, ammunitions, maps, scenarios, gameplay, everything is much more realistic than usual and weapons are really lethals, wrong maneuvers will not be forgiven ! much more similar to our beloved German Soldiers Mod.

The Singleplayer experience is hands down the best you can find on a MOW title.

The theme, being WW1, can be considered niche and less "cool" compared to WWII, but this is not necessarily true, when I tried it for the first time it was like "fresh air" , finally something different.
You need to sweat to gain every inch of the battlefield and you gain terrain thanks to a multitude of units that allow you to use different tactics, it's not just infantry, artillery and trenches.

If you are not interested in WWI at all then I suggest you to keep this game mods tracked, being the Engine lighter and allowing for more units on screen and bigger maps, I'am sure many modders will find in it the perfect environment for their mods and maybe we will see a WWII mod too : )

EDIT: the first WWII mod already arrived shortly after release : )

cheers

HaZZarD

author: {'steamid': '76561198014846799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1700886576}
review:
I have been a long time fan of the Men of War series for years and through multiple iterations of the series and I think this one is pretty good, which is amazing when you consider for years the small team developing this game were just a bunch of modders trying to make their dream of a detailed WW1 mod for Men of War come true. 

The game, in its state at the time of this review, is fun. The current French and Russian campaigns are very detailed and interesting, spanning the early weeks of 1914 all the way to the final offensives of the war. The mission variety is very good, with the classic Men of War stealth missions, defense missions in all kinds of terrain where you have to frantically patch holes in you lines after devestating artillery, large scale offensives involving hundres of men on the map at a single time, and even unique missions where you forrage for food and supplies while dodging germans to guiding french airmen in their escape from a German prison fortress.

As you play the game you will find yourself naturally evolving to WW1 tactics just as the officers of the time did. Initially you will see yourself using your 16 man squads to fulfill objectives in mass attacks that wreak horrendous casualties (2000 men died in one mission, and only one corner of a building in a town remained standing) but later slowly adapt to infiltration tactics by smaller units. 

The game adds a lot of flavor in addition to the obvious unit design changes (which are fantastic and historically accurate). You can tell the developers truly love this era in time, as each mission is fleshed out with neat things like horse drawn artillery and sleds, units that change appearance as the war progresses (pickelhaubes to stalhelms, etc)

My hours don't reflect my true playtime since I have launched it outside of steam more often than I have from the steam client. Over my entire playtime I can honestly say that the only negative points I can honestly point out would be due to the limitations the Men of War engine (sometimes the UI is tough to use in massive battles on the highest difficulty) and some still evolving issues with multiplayer. Fortunately the devs are very attentive and care deeply about their game so I am sure these issues will be fixed. Multiplayer also suffers from a moderately low player count from the US/Europe.

Another flaw is the campaigns are pretty much all purchased separately, which is a tad ridiculous but you can always make your own I suppose. 

Overall 7/10, pretty good but could be improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030893346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1642902552}
review:
[h1]Brief review of the early acces version (French & Russian Campaigns):[/h1]

This is "Men of War" in a WWI context and I love the idea because there are far too few good games focusing on this era. In short, I like playing the parts of the game that work. The reason I don't recommend the game is that it still need A LOT of work and the bar seems to be set way too low for parts that are "Completed". A few examples:

 [*] Horrible voice acting: There are one or two guys doing all the voices in very bad english. This gives the whole game a feeling of "unprofessionalism" and this element is simply no good.
 [*] Bad cut-scenes: In addition to the poor voice acting are bad cut scenes that interupt your fight at the worst possible times. Often, the meaning of these cut scenes are not very clear and they give me the impression that the campaigns are done by an amateur modder and not a professional team.
 [*] Unfinished campaign: The Russian campaign is still pretty seriously bugged, despite the developers statement that:  [quote=author]‚ÄúWe have completed the development of the first two campaigns (France and the Russian Empire), and actively test the third."[/quote]
This is a really annoying fact that can ruin the trust you put in a game developer. Realising that the game is still in early access, parts still have to be properly tested before moving on. When it is not, I worry about how well the rest of the game will be developed.
[*] A step backwards: Compared to "Men of War", this game seems to be a step back. The quality is just not as good, especially with regards to voices & cut scenes, plus the many bugs and lack of finish. 

I really hope these things will be fixed and the game will come out on top. If not, it will be yet another terrible display of shoddy game making.
