author: {'steamid': '76561198024299559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1704, 'last_played': 1474025879}
review:
[DISCLAIMER: The following review was last updated in 2015, the gameplay may have changed since then.]

Do I recommend this game? As it looks now, no. Unless you want to support the developers, which may or may not help them fix the issues I've encountered below. Don't count on it.

This is going to be my first serious review ever made, because it is needed.

First off, let me explain my experience with the Men of War franchise.
I was an ex-modder for Men of War, Men of War Vietnam and Men of War Assault Squad as well as the head of the Men of War Fanclub on moddb.com You may know me as craftan99. This is important to note so that you will know how much knowledge I have of how the game engine works and how it's assets is used. I have safely over 1000+ hours on Men of War offline back when It was a retail version. Now, on to the game.

The developers of this game, "The Great War Team", have claimed that the single player is finished. However, this is not the case. There are several localization issues where items and weapons miss names. The writing of the dialogues are awful and usually the voice acting and subtitles don't match to what they're saying and some dialogue is recorded with a very poor microphone. Also, little is explained as how to accomplish certain objectives without much direction as to what is required to do certain objectives. Some times you need certain items and it's a pain if you've somehow don't have that item because you dropped it somewhere. The game is also very lacking in Sound Assets, or maybe lacking isn't the word to use. I'd say that it has poor quality. Some guns sound very off when it comes to some kind of noise feedback that is in the background. Horses galopping is also a great example at terrible sound. This series is known to have bad voice acting as Men of War's developers had the same issue. However, I don't know if "The Great War Team" was even responsible for the voice acting or if they asked for support from the main developers of the franchise. In any case, it needs to be redone completely. There are tons of people who would volounteer without payment. Websites like behindthevoiceactors.com let's people try out for voice roles. Why they didn't do this, beats me. 

The mission designs aren't the best either, they aren't very consistent and stealth is usually a hard task, but it is possible. However, stealth missions are rather tedious. Speaking of difficulty and missions, I always found the defense missions in the French and Russian campaigns to be extremely easy to complete. I think it's because the waves of enemies where so small that they were easily fended off. 

When it comes to balancing, the artillery reload speed need to be longer and the infantry sprint endurance bar needs to be longer. Either that or faster recharges on the bar. Artillery HE rounds could also use some balancing to maybe lower the AoE just a bit, I always found the artillery redicioulously overpowered. Even with realism, balancing is needed to make the experience more fun and engaging. Artillery spam is hardly fun. Tanks are perfectly balanced in my opinion and I don't see much needed in the ways of improving that.

This wasn't much of a review as it is explaining what this game needs to fix. Even if this is in Early Access, these are things that have been overlooked and should be completely redone.

Basically:
* The Campaign is not finished, even if the developers claim it is.
* Awful writing.
* Awfully easy defense missions where the waves are too small.
* Poor sound assets with bad voiceacting.
* Some icons have bad artwork.
* Localization issues.
* Tedious Stealth Missions.
* Balancing Issues.

Suggestions:
* Add realistic color to the mustard gas, yellow.
* Add more types of gas and apply equally realistic color. (White Cross, Green Cross and Blue Cross.)
* Add more unit types to Multiplayer. (Bavarian Infantry, French Chasseurs, Canadian Royal Rifles, White Russian Guard)
* Add Cavalry and the ability to attack with horses.
* Add better and fresher animations for the infantry.



All in all, I've enjoyed the hell out of the game, but I would enjoy it even more if these issues were fixed. I would be so happy if it was. 

Thank you for your time.

review: Where to start. Well this game was a eye opener to me. I never heard of a "men of war" before and when i played this i bought the original game just months later. I really love this game. First off this game is SOOOOO detailed its kinda scary. Example: If an artillery shell goes off near a truck and a small peice of shrapnel hits the gas tank, the truck will explode, flip on its side and your men can use the blazed truck as cover. Thats how detailed this game is. It is also very historically accurate and fun to play. Playing the french campaign was a blast. The only bad things with this game is level design for some french mission. For instance i cant pass the fort vaux mission because the AI is too damned advanced to beat. The english voice over is a bit awkward but its definitly understandable since the devs are french and i think russian. So overall i highly recommend giving this a try. There is a bit of a learning curve when it comes to controls but it is a very fun and genuine war game :)

review:
I think this is the best game I've ever played.
The tutorial is confusing, but once you get past it, its WAY more fun.

Face it, if your reading these reviews, you're already going to buy the game.  Stop wasting time and get in the trenches.

Also, i've noticed several people complaining of the new bug, that was introduced with one of the last couple updates.  Simply erase the local data and reinstall, your progress WILL BE SAVED.  Everything should work again :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018326515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1486846546}
review:
Awesome game with some HUGE potential.  Really can't wait to see how this game will shape up.  Would be great to see the Ottomans as an added faction and the new Russian campaign.  My major gripe with the game so far is that its difficult for me to detect what's useful in the campaign levels and what's just scenary and cover.  Sometimes there are boxes with ammunition for your troops, and sometimes those boxes are just cover.  You really have to survey all your surroundings to make the most out of your strategy and I wish that the UI made this a little more user friendly.  It'd be great to just press and hold a key to light up all available boxes that you can use so you don't miss anything.  

I also really got a kick out of artillery in this game so far but found it perhaps a bit too accurate and too fast with the amount of shots you can keep pumping out.  Awesome how you can link it up to a horse and race it to another section of the fight though, great stuff!

Overall to me this feels like a Total War WWI game that we'll probably never see from SEGA so don't pass it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062363193', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1430543196}
review:
[h1][b]Battle of Empires: 1914-1918 Review[/b][/h1]

Battle of Empires: 1914-1918 (which I will refer to as BoE in this review) is a pleasantly surprising strategy game made in the mold of the Men of War series. In fact, it originally started out as a mod for MoE but has quickly shifted to become its own entity. So fanboys can stop reading, add to cart, and start enjoying - you're already sold because gameplay will be very similar and, in fact uses the same game engine. There will be a few slight differences which can be considered improvements although some nostalgic MoE players may disagree.

As for the rest of you, think World War I combat strategy on a somewhat grand scale. During gameplay players will have a variety of units to command: infantry, artillery, tanks, etc and each have their own individual inventories to allow total customization based on your combat needs. The combat is real-time and the maps are fully interactive. This means that obstacles can be destroyed, used for cover, and manipulated over the course of the battle as well as reflecting the changing landscape of the battlefield due to artillery shells, bombing runs, or even from building make-shift sandbag barricades to be used as cover. The amount of detail put into the units to reflect the time period is admirable and the effort does not go un-noticed. BoE truly feels like a WWI timepiece.

The game is extremely vanilla in its current Early Access state but still very playable. The developers have 5 different campaigns planned for inclusion into the full release version of the game along with additional bonus missions (possibly DLC?). Currently only the French campaign is included but the Russian campaign is almost completed and the others are currently "in progress." There is already an editor included for the purpose of modding so one can expect a lot of extra community content to be added as well. 

The game also features both co-op and multiplayer as well and both are already working in basic form but I believe more features will be added before completion. For an Early Access game there is a lot of content and playability available and I experienced no bugs or crashes so there is no need to wait.

There are a few things that I hope to see improved before the final release. The sound and voiceovers are mediocre at best and still leave a lot to be desired. Another issue is with the limitations on squads. While the game consists of large scale combat, it becomes a hindrance moving troops all around the map when you can only control a specific handful at a time. The user interface feels cluttered and unorganized. It gets the job done but overall it just doesn't feel very efficient. 

BoE includes a tutorial along with a skirmish mission before actually beginning the campaign in order to familiarize players with the various controls and such. However, at times this tutorial is vague and can be confusing, even more so for a player not familiar with this type of game and a lot of information is stuffed into this small sampling so it can quickly become overwhelming. Hopefully these elements all get ironed out before the game is released as a final product.

[h1][b]The Good:
========[/b][/h1]
[i]+  Authentic WWI atmosphere
+  Challenging strategic gameplay
+  Large variety of units and customization
+  Quality graphics 
+  Low CPU usage
+  Game speed options
+  Multiplayer and co-op features
+  Mod friendly w/editting tool included
+  Rotating camera functions smoothly
+  Steam Achievements
+  High replay value
+  Active development team[/i]


[h1][b]The Bad:
======[/b][/h1]
[i]-  Average sound and sub-par voiceovers
-  User interface is clunky and needs improvement
-  Confusing tutorial/steep learning curve
-  Squad limitations on mouseover[/i]

[h1][b]Final Thoughts:
===========[/b][/h1]
While Battle of Empires : 1914-1918 is still an "Early Access" game and the price may seem a bit lofty, there is already a lot of quality gaming content included with a lot more already in development. Plus it has an early stage multiplayer feature and comes with an editor for modding. I recommend RTS fans to grab this game now because the price could easily go up once all of the content is added. The gameplay is solid, the content is of good quality, and this game is just as fun and challenging as Men of War.


[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006580928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1584313356}
review:
Not great the promise is there they keep updating it which is a good sign, but thats when the trouble starts last patch and DLC you couldn't download the only current way is to uninstall the game then reinstall,  if you pay good money for download or have limited amount then this is a problem...so everytime theres a update now u will have to reinstall...bypass this one for now.

Just a update for this review the issue with the queing update has not been fixed officially basically as mentioned before you have to reinstall...
Also this game has some touchy moderators who won't tolerate anything bad being said about the game in the forums, now i bought it for 15 bucks a month or two ago and have only spent 2 hours in game...basically you can't play it reinstalling is the only way, now a dll isue which u have to replace each time you do the install, so anymore BS updates and its time to download again...

[Update]
Despite what i wrote above i'm big enough to admit this review needs to be turned around a little...i have given it a thumbs up now, the developers seem to be constantly working on this project and adding more content and a lot of the bugs are being dealt with..although i don't agree with having to purchase content for the game, the game should be sold with full content and just add a completion price..but it is what it is and they need to make a dollar for their time, and they are putting a big effort in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057852927', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1537393913}
review: When I first saw the game on the workshop i was intrigued to learn more about it.  I found the game to be quite historical and very fun to play. Through my time playing the game i have spent time playing and also Experimenting in the editor. The Game is currently in early access yet it has already peaked my interest and ive been following it trying to keep up with everything going on with the game. I would rate Battle of Empires: 1914-1918 10/10 for the replayability and the ability for mod support! 10/10 would rush my men straight to their death again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051316142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1506226935}
review:
As a big fan of MOW series I figured I'd give this a go  but was not expecting it to be quite so similar.    I've resisted buying MOW Assault Squad 2   because I didn't like paying again for essentially the same game  when there are numerous excellent free mods available for the original.   Much was my surprise then when I got into  BoE  to find it 99.8% genetically identical to MOW.   Some tiny differences in UI   and of  course WW1 instead of WW2.    

That said it's as thrilling and engaging as MOW -  just don't expect a different game !

6/10   (  9 out of 10 if I'd never played MOW).

author: {'steamid': '76561198137466952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1555917395}
review: Rush your objective in a hail of fire taking heavy casualties? Dig in and drag it out popping off the occaisional shot at the enemy lines thinning them out safely? Or level it with artillery possibly using rounds you might need later? I like that you can play this your own way. WW1 feel is done brilliantly. Britian/Australia Campaign puh-leez.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999494448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1472233749}
review:
Yes Early Access but one of the good ones! Every wanted to play WWI in a realistic setting? Then get this game. I got it 2 days ago and I am addicted to it. The multiplayer is fun and the compaign is good as well. 

If you like sending multitudes of infantry to their death and destroy every little thing, including buildings with your mortars and artillery, then this game is for you :D 

Of course it needs some tweeking and I hope they keep patching it, making it run smoother, better maps, bigger battles etc. 

As of right now I highly recommend this game! IT IS FUN!

review:
This is a ram gem. There are far too few games dealing with the Great War, so it is nice to have this one. It plays very similar to Men at War, so if you have played it before, you should be able to slid right into the gameplay. 

The controls aren't the most intuitive, so there is a steeper learning curve with the button control. But once you get comfortable with them, you are able to enjoy the richness of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063824871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1480974984}
review:
Battle of Empires : 1914-1918 is a World War One strategy game currently in Early Access. 

Based on the Men of War series engine, you will be tasked to lead your forces in some of the bloodiest battles of the conflict. For the moment, only the French campaign has been released though others will follow such as with the German and Russian Empires. 

In Multiplayer you can choose several nations to play with and this in several mod ( such as Control where you have to hold flags to win points, Combat where you simply have to destroy the enemy without perticular objective,...Etc ). 

I bought this game day one and must congratulate the devs for a quite smooth release ( at least for me ). There has not been any major bug that ruined my game or broke it. Patches are quite frequent and the devs seem to be working a lot on improving everything. 

Good points :

- If you like the MoW gameplay, you will like the game ( micromanaging units, ammo, ...Etc )
- Detailed units and uniforms. There are plenty of several units for each nation. Tanks, artillery, machine-guns, colonial troops,...Etc
-Detailed maps in the campaign. Some of the maps are very well done such as the fort in the French campaign. Impressive!
- Various game modes in Multiplayer ensure good replayability.
- Many missions per campaign and more campaigns to come. 
- Some missions can be done different ways ( stealth or berserk )
- An editor included in the game

Bad points or things that need to be changed/improved

- The voice acting : I'm not holding that too much against the devs. It's early access and having the people and ressources to record in several languages may not be easy! However it seem that they will change the voice acting in some parts which is good. 
- Some sounds! THough there are sounds that are very well done, some rifle and or machine guns could be better. 



Anyway, I recommand this game, it is really good and will only improve over time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095299998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1552761014}
review:
What a great game! Battle Of Empires is difficult and makes you think. You can not just spam tanks or infantry, you have to use a combination of them wisely. Tanks are powerful, but slow and easily get wiped out by artilery, while infantry easily gets cut down, but if used correcly can take out artillery positions. I played the whole French Campaign and i must give it a 9/10, because it is in alpha and there are still a few bugs and glitches. There was a glitch where a German machine gun kept mowing down my infatry. even though there were no soldiers manning it. Sometimes Mortar crews have a hard time moving the mortar to a new position. Lastly, on some missions some scripted parts wont happen. On the mission Miracle Of the Marne, on my second playthrough of the mission, the taxis did not come with the reinforcements. These problems can easily be fixed, and i look foward to the future campaigns. I feel the problem with MoW is that tanks are used so much, and i often feel i am playing a tank game. However the Great War setting fixes that. 
                             Side Note: it comes with an Edit mode, which is a reason to buy the game on its own. It allows you to create your own maps, missions, and battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009761169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1441296820}
review:
My summary

Pros:
> Great game play
> Large dynmaic battle fields, ability to comant toops
> Sense of scale, lots of troops fighting at once
> It is fun if you are comanding a large number of troops or just one
> Gives you a sense of WWI eara warefar, its weappons, how it was fought, and its scale
> Maps are well developed, missions are fun
> Good realism

Cons:
> Voice acting is very poor and they could have worked a bit better on the English grammer.  Having said that it in no way compramises the game play so although it would be nice to have French soldiers with French accents, diddo for other nations, it is not a must.
> Difficault to comand large numbers of troops.  Can be confusing trying to find the right troops in the right part the battlefield at the right time, but then again that could be considered to enhance its realism so its not so bad.

Overall this game is a great accomplishment and I look forward to seeing it develop further.

review:
Geniales Game, auf den ersten Blick sieht es wie Men of War aus, da das Men√º, die Steuerung und das Gameplay identisch ist, was ich als Men of War Fan sehr gut finde, aber es ist diesmal ein Strategiespiel des ersten Weltkriegs bzw das Spiel spielt im Jahre 1914-1918 wie es der Name schon ver√§t.

Das Spiel ist sehr gut gelungen und macht sehr viel Spass, die einf√ºhrung von Pferden auf die man reiten und als Zugspferd f√ºr Kanonen nutzen kann, find ich sehr gut, bin sehr gespannt welche Features noch folgen werden, Flugzeuge als steuerbare Einheiten w√§ren mal toll.

Ein "must have" Spiel f√ºr jeden Men of War Fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561198130507446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1437584842}
review:
I have decided to rewrite my review because now i realise what kind of devs i helped fund.

Can you tell im angry? im incredibly angry because they lied to me, they released new DLC that was supposedly free for all early access supporters. I am an early access supporter, where the hell is my DLC? in fact why dont we check the store page on the DLC to make sure that this is not some sort of mistake.

Nope, not a mistake, want to know what makes this worse? apparently my loyalty, and anyones who bought it prior to April 22nd is only worth a 15% discount. AKA: 75p.

For the love of all that be holy do not support these devs. I am sick of being positive and giving them chances to impress me and make me think they were worth my support. DO NOT BUY THIS.

Edit #5 or something, i have stopped caring. I originally had concerns the developers would be incompetant, or otherwise untrustworthy. As much as i hate being right, i appear to be right.

Edit #6 or whatever: the devs have censored my criticism. Need any other reasons not to give them your money?

Edit who gives a shit: i have been banned from the forums for no good reason, i offered crticism and simply told someone not to buy the game if their fucking ludicrous DLC plan makes them uncomfortable. Was this bad? probably. Does this excuse them? not really, considering that they didnt even give a reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058616197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1453143578}
review:
Battle of Empires is a fantastic RTS game.  Plain and simple.  On top of that, it features the horrific weaponry and tactics of WW1 which in my opinion is one of the most underutilized settings in gaming right now.  In so many RTS games, if you have the skill, it can feel like your units posess almost super human ability as a result of your control over them. 

In Battle of Empires you will have to make choices, and your men WILL DIE because of them.  Sure that artillery strike might turn the tide of the battle you're in, but this game will force you to click on a soldier and order him to a position where he can mark the target with smoke.  Most of the time you know it's a position he won't make it back from.

What makes it so fun to me in the end is how badly you end up wanting your men to survive.  At the end of a battle I never look at how many enemy casualties I was able to inflict, but how many of my own I was able to save.  

My favorite part of the game though is the stories that emerge from just the pre-designed campaign battles.  When you finish a battle and the dust settles and you look over your surviving units, think about where each man started and what he accomplished.  If you keep your forces organized, you can watch some pretty incredible things happen.  

I feel like i'm not even talking about a game anymore, which is what makes this one fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969451117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1422552339}
review:
Really good WW1 MoW! 
I have played Men of War since it began over 13 years ago with Soldiers Heroes of WW2. I own every MoW game, including those I wish I hadnt bought like Vietnam and Condemned Heroes.

Battle of Empires 1914-1918 started as a mod and now has gone commercial. 
I think WW1 is a difficult period to tackle with RTS and there are very few for that reason. The MoW engine is perfectly suited to it though and the features of this game such as horses to tow artillery are well implemented. Graphically it is dated but I always find MoW is strong on gameplay and tactics. This game is no exception and I think this is also down to really enjoyable SP campaign.

I have honestly missed the SP campaigns from MOW since Assault Squad focusses on more linear skirmish. It is also enjoyable played Co Op.

Highly recommended even in early access. If you can forgive the voice acting and graphically outdated engine, then this is a top RTS set in WW1 that oozes atmosphere and tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1420862054}
review:
Battle of Empires: 1914 -1918
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   

Battle of Empires is very similar then Men of War series but in World War 1 era. 

You have to complete all objectives to move further into each mission.

Nicely polished graphics and the game runs very well.  All units and weapons of this era are well represented in this game. 

As you would expect this type of strategy game is challenging and keeps you on your toes from early on, which is exactly what you want.

This game is currently on early access and after playing 1 hour and 30 minutes, I did not encounter any issues so far.   
One little criticism; some of the unit actions like reloading artillery are just a little bit hard in my opinion. Bear in mind, I am comparing it with a game that works extremely well (Men of War: Assault 2). I guess a little tweak in that regards. I think the final version will be just fine.

Positive:
~~~~~~ 
-	Era well represented (units, weapons, etc)
-	Challenging mission from early on
-	A lot of achievements
-	Nice graphics 

Negative:
~~~~~~~  
-	Some of the command action (units) need to be smoother

Overall,  I like it and I am looking forward to the final version.

review:
First of all: Wow!!! This game is amazing and woth every penny to spend to it! I follow the mod since the early beginning 4 years ago, so I really wanted to get it! So about bugs and glitches:
campaign: The only bug I encountered is a sound bug: there is a conversation in the mission in fort waux which says "there must be another route to exit the fort" or such. Well this d√≠alogue somehow bugged and repeated several times not only in that mission, but in the followings also (when I zoomed I could heared it)
editor: Most of my playtime I spent with the editor and there are several bugs there. First of all about the instantly crash things: all 3 armenian soldiers, the opel tented truck, the grey austro-hungarian helmet and some other items causes the game immediately crash, not even spoke of the things left from men of war, which also causes crash, like helmets, weapons, skins etc.
so far about bugs.
some advice: as a hungarian, I inspected the Austro-Hungarian army to give you some infos about what to change. First of all, the skins are beautiful, but there are some minor problems: austro-hungarian soldiers at that time wore mustaches, so most appropriate would be to do same faces as kaiserj√§gers. It would be nice to add more sounds for them, not only german, but hungarian and a slavic one also. I read that you are planning to add AH to multiplayer, which is a good decision. If I can suggest something, if u think about an elite squad, there should be bosnian troops (like highlander in britain)
Some other requests: As many others, I would like to have all the campaign and multiplayer maps in editor, I thinks this is not a big deal. I would like to ask about the mustard gas shells, I see there is a damage, called mustard gas, but it did not work, just it is same as a normal explosion. It would be nice to add mustard gas shells to cannons also and explain how it works in editor. I also dont understand, why you removed BAR from the game, it saw minor battles in 1918 so it should be in editor at least. I miss the famous Gotha bomber from german side, If it is not in the singleplayer you should add is to the editor

If you have any questions about austro-hungarian army or need some help, you can count on me!! ;)
Wish all the bests from Hungary!! And a happy new year to you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040839092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1568847458}
review:
A very good use of the Men of war game engine! Ill be honest when I first saw the WW1 mods for MOW I was excited thought could they pull this off??? what much else can you do with a bunch of guys with rifles?? with previous expericen int he other games rifles could be the last weapon of choice as they are flimsy in the aim and even worse in direct control, also is there a danger that this could get boring??? But the result from the get go, I was pleasently suprised! Instead of being boring confrontations that drag out there is a level of intesity that keeps you on your toes from the moment the opening camera shot begins to the end of the mission. This games mission design appears in my opinion better than the Assult sqaud style of gameplay. Which was good but lacked suffcient storyline and character. However with Battle of empires, there is a sense of value in the units (that i didnt get with MOWAS 1&2) and a story that builds for great gameplay. This game takes you back to the rpg strategy and it pays homage to the original MOW and red tide series which (ok sketching ai at times) had very well produced missions models and stories with clever twists that made you play on. I get that with 1914-1918 I just feel that same structure. It creates intensity that reflects that First World War in a respectful and original fashion. Why is the game so good?? Your units are vital and if you dont act quickly YOU LOSE ;). Example the fact that Constantly at any point your whole squad can be wiped out by a single artillery shell or the new shrapnal bursts. And those are enough to make even the most seasoned MOW vets tremble in their boots ;) It makes for a truly emersive ww1 experince true to history chronologically and details from the weapons to the hopeless endever of trench warfare. Sure the game is dodgy on some ai and skin colours but with improvement your looking at a rival to the original MOW and FOW.
My advice
If your a fan of MOW, FACES OF WAR OR RED TIDE?
YOU NEED TO ADD THIS TO YOUR COLLECTION ;)
Step into the trenches and feel the shrapnal burst above your head I dare you ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069381783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1422385016}
review:
My general impression thus far is positive. Having played a lot of MoW, AS1 and AS2 over the past 2 years or so I can say quite honestly that if you've enjoyed any of these games you can be quite certain that this game is worth the investment. 

Some things which I hope developers will spend time in improving however:


- The game could be improved substantially in mirroring AS2's interface. It may seem a trivial point but icons above the heads of vehicles, weapons teams, squads and individual soldiers is invaluable in locating and directing them. In several games while defending in Frontline precious seconds have been lost spent trying to find my howitzer/trench gun/machinegun because they are not as well marked or clearly visible as in AS2. I expect this problem will be rectified soon enough as such icons are intuitively lacking to players of past MoW games.

- The camera moves far too quickly. I expect this can be solved in fiddling with the settings but it's far too jerky and sensitive in default. Micromanaging units can be tricky enough without having the screen dart about owing to one's cursor inadvertently coming into close proximity to the edges of the screen. 

- I do not understand why the select and move button are both the left mouse key, as was the case in MoW1. It's wrong. I really, really do not like it. The left button should be for selecting and the right for moving. 

- The multiplayer maps need more cover and undulating terrain. They feel rather sparse at the moment, lacking even shell holes or craters to aid the advance of men. Quite often infantry are utterly at the mercy of artillery owing to a distinct lack of cover to shelter behind or hide in. I find myself having to spam infantry in the hopes that only a few will survive long enough to acheive what I wish of them. I do however appreciate the developers are trying to reflect the reality of combat in no man's land, I just wish however it could be done a little more sympathetically to those trying to preserve the lives of their men!

That's all I can think of at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012479972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1422192161}
review:
I bought this game alongside Assault Squad 2. Before that I played mostly CoH and the Great 1918 mod for it. I also played a few of Condemned Heroes not long ago. When I bought the two games I was expecting to play more of Battle of Empires, which I did at first, but I instead enjoy Assault Squad 2 more. It may not be fair to compare the two, but in some cases I will.

First of, it is nice to see a world war 1 game. There are not many games that do this theme. I think the French singleplayer does a good job of portraying the war. The missions I played I liked better than Condemned Heroes. However I feel that the multiplayer has a identity problem. It seems without direction. I do not know if it is geared towards competive play or authenticity. Assault Squad 2 strives for competive play, and so we see units of various time periods and even experimental units in the case of Japan. I personally do not like this, but do understand it.

I feel that Battle of Empires fells short on competive play. It seems more casual with the focus on frontlines - assault zones have been added however. Thus I would expect more focus on authenticity. This is personal, but I am not so keen on the mixing around of time periods. Experimental vehicles can especially ruin any authenticity. The Great War 1918 mod did a far better job, it combines historical accuracy and gameplay much better. Compared to Men of War however, Company of Heroes gameplay is something I rather not go back to. When it comes to more realistic gameplay, and so more authentic gameplay, Men of War is much better.

To who do I recommend this? If you would like to play World War One singleplayer, this game is a good choice. It now has a French campaign, but additional campaigns - British, German and Russian - will be added. It is also a good choice if you want to play online in a World War One setting. For competive play I wouldn't recommend this. If you are looking for an (more) authentic Great War mod you might be a bit dissapointed. The Great War 1918 mod does a much better job at that. In Battle of Empires defense, it is more difficult to portray the whole war than a period of it. And Battle of Empires has Russians, will have Italians in some way and of course picklehaube - which the Great War 1918 mod does not have.

We must consider however that Battle of Empires is still in development. Overall it is a decent game. I did enjoy the multiplayer games that I played and I did not experience any bugs.

Keep it up Battle of Empires team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027998184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1431224207}
review:
Si te gustaron los Men of War, aqui tienes la vrsion del mismo pero en la WW1. Graficos, jugabilidad, nivel de dificultad, unidades historicas, campos de batalla, todo forma un combo de gran calidad. Explosiones con un aspecto visual y sonoro epicos, unidades bien dise√±adas, los tanques est√°n muy bien hechos, se nota que ha habido investigacion y horas de trabajo y estudio para lograr un juego estrategico de la Primera guerra mundial sin precedentes, todo en tiempo real, lo que te obliga a evaluar todo el cuadro operacional y no solo el peque√±o sector donde tenes algunas tropas desplegadas. Usar tus ingenieros para volar puentes, los telefonistas para desplegar el telefono de camp√°√±a y llamar a la artiller√≠a, el poder capturar las armas enemigas y usarlas contra sus anteriores due√±os, la artilleria tirada por caballos, el tener que ir hasta las cajas de municion para repostar los ca√±ones y las ametralladoras, diferentes tipos de municion, como el schrappel, que explota en el aire y siembra esquirlas por todos lados, el ver como tus hombres son diezmados en las trincheras por la artilleria enemiga y luego asaltados por la infanteria, las luchas a fusil de cerrojo, ametralladoras pesadas, granadas de mano y bayoneta no tienen comparacion con otros juegos.
Un juego estrategico hecho por gente que ama la estrategia y el nivel historico absoluto, para gamers que quieren una simulacion estrategica digna de un general.
espero les guste este juego tanto como me ha gustado a mi.
Saludos

author: {'steamid': '76561197996537293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1434059065}
review:
Mon temps de jeu √©tant encore limit√©, je ne partage ici que mes premi√®res impressions. Je mettrai donc √† jour cette √©valuation ult√©rieurement.

Au premier abord, le jeu est s√©duisant. Premi√®rement parce que j'ai toujours aim√© le syst√®me Men of War (√©chelle escouade, contr√¥le direct des unit√©s...) et deuxi√®mement parce que √ßa fait plaisir d'avoir un jeu bien r√©alis√© sur la Premi√®re Guerre mondiale.
Certes l'interface est parfois confuse (Assault Squad fait mieux) et il faut consacrer quelques minutes pour changer les touches et adapter les contr√¥les √† son go√ªt mais une fois fait ce n'est que du plaisir. Les blind√©s sont magnifiques et les scripts des missions sont suffisamment bien pens√©s pour toujours offrir des rebondissements.

Le moteur est toujours efficace en 2014 et seule la gestion des collisions et le pathfinding al√©atoire parviennent √† nous agacer. Evidemment l'√©chelle est trop petite pour restituer les combats de tranch√©es mais c'est un plaisir de jouer avec les unit√©s et √©quipements de l'√©poque. La campagne fran√ßaise est la seule accessible √† l'heure actuelle mais d'autres doivent la rejoindre. En ajoutant √† cela les cartes en multi, on obtient un jeu tr√®s solide, effectivement bien plus ambitieux que le mod qu'il √©tait initialement.

Toutefois les nouveaut√©s ne sont pas l√©gion en termes de gameplay donc si vous n'avez pas aim√© un titre de la s√©rie Men of War (et Faces of War / Soldiers Heroes of WW2), difficile de vous le conseiller. Mais pour les autres, cela vaut le d√©tour et m√™me en early access, le contenu disponible √©tant suffisamment important et de qualit√© pour avoir confiance.

Mes impressions plus d√©taill√©es dans la vid√©o ci-dessous :
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=361501049

author: {'steamid': '76561198036490451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1544533126}
review:
El juego es estupendo, y eso que est√° en acceso anticipado, en el men√∫ puedes ir empezando dos campa√±as una de Francia y la otra no estoy seguro pero las dos primeras misiones tambi√©n son con Francia, te puedes encontrar con sorpresas como que el enemigo se rinde o que la munici√≥n de tu artiller√≠a se agota enseguida. Tambi√©n han inclu√≠do pesta√±as para conseguir refuerzos, pelotones, barreras de artiller√≠a etc. Las misiones que de momento he jugado son tipo Faces of War, Men of war original, RT, me refiero a que no son del tipo MOW:AS, lo cual para m√≠ es positivo, del online no puedo decir nada porque a√∫n no lo he probado. Los uniformes son la leche y si entiendes de la 1¬™G.M. te har√° ilusionarte con cada peque√±o detalle. Hay misiones tanto de ofensivas gigantes como de llevar a cuatro tiradores a robar unos documentos.
Para los que hablamos espa√±ol es un poco complicado porque lo tenemos que jugar en ingl√©s (o ruso) pero lo cierto es que es un ingl√©s sencillo, positivo para enterarte de la historia o en caso de no saber ingl√©s, el sistema de combate es muy intutivo, como en los juegos de la saga Men Of War.
Me he topado con algunos errores que causan CTD en el editor as√≠ como una textura buggeada de un sombrero.
Los sonidos de los rifles dejan que desear: cuando se recarga con un f√∫sil alem√°n no recuerdo si era el kar98k o el mannlicher 98 suena como una especie de viento por detr√°s que es inc√≥modo y te saca del realismo y ning√∫n rifle tiene el sonido del cerrojo, el cual resulto ser muy agradable incluy√©ndolo el la gran actualizaci√≥n del MOW:AS.
El  casco alem√°n m1915 se queda posicionado por encima de las cabezas de al menos los soldados autroh√∫ngaros, los que hemos hecho alg√∫n mod del MOW sabemos que tiene f√°cil soluci√≥n. Algunas pistolas si realizas  disparos R√ÅPIDOS seguidos s√≥lo se escuchan dos o tres. 
Ah eso s√≠, el sistema de da√±o, el alcance de las arm√°s as√≠ como los efectos que causan sobre el terreno la explosi√≥n de proyectiles lo han mejorado mucho, ahora no tienes que ponerte a un paso del soldado enemigo para disparar con una pistola.
Estos fallos son perfectamente solucionables, pero ya digo que a excepci√≥n del de sonido de los rifles los otros s√≥lo me han ocurrido en el editor, y aseguro que este es un pedazo de juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122816188', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1627232659}
review:
Excellent. I've been waiting for this game since the day I saw the concept trailer. Essentially I have been waiting for a game like this since I was just a little historian. In the midst of the chaos and carnage of the game I actually found myself pausing or exiting the session because I was so jaw-dropped at how horrific war is; feeling morally uncomfortable with a game (unless naturally we're speaking of "This War of Mine") is a first for me. 


Graphics are some of the best in the business in my opinion. Contends with, if not better then Men of War. Think Jagged Alliance: Crossfire but extensively smoother then any Jagged Alliance game. When the artillery hits the enemy you're almost always compelled to give a long straught exhale to the poor lads on the recieving end of the shell.

I'm really hoping for a add-on of Canadian troops within British/Commonwealth forces (I see a Russian flag in the game logo as well, I think that speaks for itself). Looking forward to seeing if this game reaches the potential it has.

10/10 recommended to all stratagy wiz's and those wishing to know a little more about the horrific catastrophe known as World War One.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015473636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1489342368}
review:
Well, after waiting years for the release of this game, I finally had the chance to play it. 
It was initially a mod, and now it's... this.

Pros:
- Historical accuracy.
- Well-designed levels
- Combat immersion
- One of the few WW1 games that are actually any good.
- You can charge huge masses of infantry at machine guns and cannons.
- You can also anihilate hundreds of people when the enemy throws a similar charge at YOUR positions.

Cons:
- Well, it's the same old MoW, with all its' flaws. The AI doesn't seem as annoying as in other games based on this engine, but it's still... not stellar.
- For some, the graphics might not be enough, though they are more than sufficient for me.
- You can't give commands to more than 8 infantry units at a time. This problem exists with all of the MoW games, but this is the only one in which you give orders to huge masses of infantry on daily basis. And so, it might be a slight problem at times.
- Minor bugs that will surely be fixed once it's out of Early Access.

If you've been waiting for a WW1 RTS for a long time, as I did, this is a game for you. It's not a polished AAA gem, but it's a good game nevertheless. Especially when you take into consideration that it is the first commercial project of a small studio. If you're somehow new to the genre(and, given that you're reading this, I doubt that), I would  rather recommend chosing one of the more popular, well-acclaimed games in this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059134388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1489949611}
review:
So far there have been some bugs but they've been worked out. As of the time of writing this, only the French campaign is there with the tank and russian ones in the works. Has multiplayer but no skirmish, which stinks because multiplayer is the only real way to use the units you want.  The campaign feels like you are learning new things the whole time so you never get the feeling of really being able to use everything, but other than that the campaign is rather fun. 

+Fun campaign (The last mission is the best in my opinion - it has a field combat and ccity combat with a large variety of units and different situations)
+Cool units
+NIce looking graphics
+Comes with two more campaigns being released in future
+Possibility for Skirmish
+Nice playing a WW1 game 
+Pretty accurate uniforms
+Fair price
+Some tanks that I never really knew about (The french ones that look like boxes)
+I like how tactics played a big part in the game (The last mission near the end was the best example of this - timing was everythings)

-No Skirmish
-Bugs (But it is early release)
-Campaign is a litte short
-No skirmish
-German campaign is a pay for one; I would much rather have German than Russian campaign
-No skirmish
-Terrible voice acting
-No skirmish
-The units have some wierd pathfinding (The french tanks tried to cross the river, not the big bridge right infront of them. Guess its their Frenchness)
-Please add skirmish eventually.  

Overall: 7.5 to 8 out of 10. I dont regret buying it and look forward to the new campaigns (Both the free Russian and Tank ones and the german pay-for one).
 
- No trading cards but thats not really important, like I rather them work on the game (Skirmish for God's sake)

review:

Not happy with the end of early acces

The worst thing about this is that they made an season pass, and when i look at wich DLC is yet to come(British empire, german campaign multiplayer pack 2 or something) i Think that should have been included in the final build and they could just have made the ottoman empire or extra great crafted campaign maps as DLC.

So schw√§chelt die KI ein wenig aber dieses Manko wird durch Masse wettgemacht(Freund/Feind verluste auf Normalem Schwierigkeitsgrad 65,2 /215,6 das spricht f√ºr die intensit√§t von BoE aber man kann ja argumentieren die Kriegsf√ºhrung aller Seiten 14,18 war ja auch bekantlich nicht die hellste ^^). Auch wundert es das man ein umgefallenes Gesch√ºtz das aber sonst in Takt ist mit seinen 120 Soldaten nichr wieder aufrichten kann. Nun die Missionen sind leicht zu durchschauen (wenn du eine Aid Station in der n√§he hast kannst dir sicher sein das die H√∂lle √ºber dich hereinbricht oder die position und der Aufbau der Nsc Einheiten sagt dir von woher der Hauptangriff kommt^^)  aber da das Spiel noch ein Early Ac. ist denk ich hohlen die Entwickler noch mehr raus mit der Zeit.Aufjeden macht BoE richtig Laune und hat denke ich gro√ües Potential. author: {'steamid': '76561197987290452', 'num_games_owned': 3114, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1430090502}
review:
**EDIT** Unfortunately due to the devs charging seperately for every piece of content I'm changing my rating to a no. The developers are really trying to take advantage of the community with this one.

**original early access review**

I'm a sucker for anything made with the Gem engine. If you enjoyed Men of War, Faces of War, or Soldiers Heroes of WWII you should enjoy this game. Note this is not really like Assault Squad, more like the original Men of War. 

Pros
- An RTS that focuses on WWI, something thats rare in and of itself.
- Crazy in depth unit management, each unit, and vehicle has its own inventory.
- Everything can be used or captured by you. See an enemy using a machine gun? Kill him and take it, running low on ammo? Search a dead body and scavenge some. See an artilery gun you want? Kill the crew and use it against the enemy.
- Physics are kickass as always, fully destructible buildings and vehicles.

Cons
- Doesn't look as good as Men of War, something about the uniforms just looks off with the lighting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085790550', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1437068644}
review:
[SEE EDIT UNDER FIRST SECTION]
Dec 20, 2014 @ 11:43am
It's a solid early game. It very much is Men Of War but WWI, and has a good feel to it. Of course, as it is in its early stages it is prone to some unbalances (have not noticed much) and bugs (not noticed any yet). Overall, its going to be a solid game and I would recommend it for those who are fans of WWI and/or RTS-style games.

EDIT: April 12, 2016 @ 7:03pm
Bought the early access version to support what I thought would be a fantastic game, wrote a nice review for it, and what did I come back to? I came back to find out that I have to buy the rest of the campaign and other misc. things I thought would be in the final release for Early-Access buyers. I'm highly disappointed in the decision the developers made to do something like this. In light of this decision I can no longer recommend this game to anyone.

EDIT: April 18, 2018 @ 10:35pm
I came back to see whether or not the Deveopers had decided to give players a game that wasn't hidden behind a rediculous paywall. I see that the campaign that I had so long awaited after purchasing the Deluxe Edition in Early Access is still unfortunately being sold as DLC rather than being part of the game as it should have been. Developers: if you are reading this then just know that you had an opportunity to make a great game that many people could have enjoyed, but you instead decided to dice it up and use it as a way to nickel and dime players. I feel its especially a betrayal to those like myself, who saw great potential in your game and bought during Early Access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162149499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1452526069}
review: J'ai beaucoup appr√©ci√© de trouver un jeu sur la Premi√®re Guerre Mondiale et dont la campagne est ax√©e sur l'arm√©e fran√ßaise. J'ai appr√©ci√© le syst√®me de gestion des escouades, des armes et des munitions, ainsi que le syst√®me de couverture. N√©anmons, je reproche l'absence de campagne suppl√©mentaire (comme une campagne russe, anglaise, am√©ricaine, allemande ou austro-hongroise), le manque de diversit√© des armes lourdes (mitrailleuses, canons, mortiers, etc...) et le manque de r√©alisme du doublage en fran√ßais. De plus, l'animation des fantassions est convaincante dans les postures, sauf dans l'animation de l'usage des armes. La campagne manque de diversit√© dans les missions (malgr√© les possibilit√©s d'infiltration et de manoeuvres des escouades d'infanteri). Il est √† noter cependant que les combats sont bien rendus et tendent √† nous plonger dans l'enfer de la Premi√®re Guerre Mondiale de mani√®re efficace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008258393', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1602, 'last_played': 1666815853}
review:
Para este tipo de jugos prefiero los Company of Heroes, pero est√° muy bien, aunque para poder hacer partidas contra la IA, que no sean de la campa√±a, tienes que pagar por un dlc. Los gr√°ficos son muy malos, se ve como turbio, no me gusta nada.

El dlc Realistic War es penoso, los soldados vomitan corriendo o mientras disparan y la sangre de las rodillas y codos parecen pelotoas de pin-pon rojas pegadas a dicha parte del cuerpo.

No hay inteligencia artifical con la que poder jugar en el multijugador, por lo que el individual es solo unas campa√±as mal hechas y el modo editor con escasos mapas.

Adem√°s hay numerosos bugs, las minas antitanque no se pueden usar, entre otros objetos, porque si las usas te salta al escritorio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060127914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1534170322}
review: This game is one of the bet rts games ever I have always enjoyed ww1 but this game is unique in that although you can do massive stratergy there is single inventorys so that if your solidier runs out of ammo you can crawl over no mans land and scavenge ammo but if i were to rate it 9/10 the one point missing missions little less long

author: {'steamid': '76561197993554628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1645291631}
review:
Alright, I randomly happend across this game, and after looking over the reviews decided to buy it, i was a huge fan of the command and conquer generals games, love rts games. Anyway, got the game and started playing. Now well go over the nit picks and the BAD:--- (Mind you i know this game is a work in progress so hopfully most of the things will be addressed, im hoping for updating and work on the game, its amazing.) So nitpicking quick, voice acting, boo but not a big deal, little bit buggy sometimes, caracters getting stuck or glitching, and there is NO SKRIMISH MODE, i must say i demand a skrimsh mode, the only multiplayer game i have been able to get into, was a trench domination battle, i got my ass handed to me, but it was the funnest rts i have played in a long time. Getting off subject, but thats pretty much it.
I could go on and on about the GOOD---- the depth of the stratagy aspect is amazing, realistic down to every damn character you controll having and invintory, a bit overwhelming at first i will admit, but god this is what i have been looking for in a rts and this game, in my opinion, is setting the way, i demand more work on the developers part on this game and i want to see this game kick off, willing to donate even. So in a nutshell its hard as hell but once you get the hang of it, you will never be board, i defanetly reccomend this to hardcore rts players, stay with it and support it and it will get better!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979293676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 3380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3179, 'last_played': 1436128245}
review:
Juego todavia en desarrollo , por lo tanto se iran produciendo sucesivas entregas parciales a lo largo del 2015 hasta completar la version final.
Interesante por la tematica  . Es un mod de la Primera Guerra Mundial para Men Of War I . IMPRESCIDIBLE para incondicionales , frikis y seguidores de la saga MEN OF WAR , FACES OF WAR, CODEMNED HEROES , ASSAULT SQUAD 2 y VIETNAM .
Sin embargo parece de ritmo menos frenetico que sus predecesores . La infanteria es vulnerable, principalmente armada con fusiles de repeticion , no puede protagonizar proezas heroicas como las que permiten Assault Squad  . Los lentos carros pesados son de apariencia estrambotica en extremo , armatostes con ametralladoras o ca√±ones . Los  vehiculos ligeros o auto ametralladoras son graciosos, como carromatos con motor . Y ademas la clasica artilleria pesada, la de campa√±a, ametralladoras pesadas, ligeras y morteros completan la panoplia del arsenal de este juego . Ademas estan los graciosos tiros de caballos para arrastrar artilleria -

Una fregatura assoluta , in pi√π le altre campagne le metteranno a PAGAMENTO ! 

L'unica cosa positiva √® il divertimento , esatto , il gioco diverte √® innegabile ma √® una fregatura comunque

author: {'steamid': '76561197970860897', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1464403493}
review: Great Fun!  Utilizing the MOW engine  I can't wait to see the finished product...at this point the game features the French campaign  But more are on the way.  WW1 has needed a game like this for a long time.  Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067823590', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1441758328}
review: Great game if you like Men Of War, already there has been a patch that has added new items and fixed a bug. Singleplayer is alright but multiplayer is where this game shines. Currently there is only one mode, frontlines, where you attack one round and defend the second. If you like RTS or WW1, pick this one up especially since it is only $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032714387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1482734064}
review:
Positive:
- you can realize your dream of being an irresponsibile WW1 commander and frontally charge MG positions with bayonet attached
- same MOW engine, the old one, the smooth one :-)
- Some new features are awesome: screen shakes after artillery strike and shrapnel granades for cannons
- Units are well designed and it is clear that a lot of work has been put into the game
- The game has  single player campaign, real campaign, not skirmishes
- soldiers will die with a single rifle bullet if hit

Negative:
- multiplayer is not that populated and the enviroment is usal MOW one. Expect host rage, quitters and disconnections. Frontline is the only game mode which is ok for WW1.
- WW1 can not give the same game deepness of WW2. Expect to have fun with the game but it will be soon repetitive.
- there is no automatic way to set the same controls as MOWAS which is the most popular game of the brand

I will update if something change as this is only early access review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012913392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1418786411}
review:
Battle of Empires is a very neat twist on the Men of War series. Its a nice change of pace from MoW. I do wish they would have used the MoWAS engine just because of the graphics and overall optimization but its still great fun. Once the full game comes out it will be even better with all the nations. 

The only con i have thus far is the machine gun noises are terrible. Besides that, the game sounds great and plays fantastic. 

9.5/10 as an early access game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111302405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1451202384}
review:
After the early access review was optimistic that the devs would fix the singleplayer campaign (hadn't played the multiplayer). But I was wrong the singleplayer game still has glitches and bugs which made the campaign unplayable. Also, they started selling DLC even when the campaigns still have problems. I like the game because it focuses on ww1 instead of ww2. I will not recommend this game at this state where they just started selling DLC and not fix the campaign, i will not recommend it until they change their business practices.

The game is very good in beta. I had not encountered any crashes but just bugs and glitches. also, i forgot to mention, most of the missions are stealth based where you must not be detected but sometimes your Ai will attack the enemy even when told not to fire at will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019417237', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1499, 'last_played': 1455747677}
review:
EDITED : Keep in mind this is an early Alpha, if you're too greedy to pay the devs a fair price for their good work it's your choice, also if there is something wrong you can give feedback (constructive criticisms are ,clearly very welcome and this new game studio is very close to the new BoE community to help us get the game we all want at release)
Most of the first issues were fixed and a new multiplayer game mode is already getting prepared.
So far it looks great but it still need A LOT of work (as we know it's an early access), hopefully the money I injected will help to stimulate the development process.
I've been waiting for this for years and I really like what I see.
Can't wait for more improvements and of course more content !
The price is fair and the game is already great in my opinion and it will certainly improve a lot.
Seeing how rare ww1 themed games are and considering the price I'd say you can almost buy it eyes closed also the single player is already amazing and incredibly well designed.
One more thing THE VOICE ACTING IS TERRIBLE IN THE FRENCH CAMPAIGN...(since I wrote that they announced that it would be changed) I have no other words (it's minor but as a Frenchmen it really hurts my senses).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970125248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1673828461}
review:
Way more fun than it lets off from the steam store's images and videos. A lot of potential and am really looking forward to the modding that can happen with a game like this.

If I had to describe the gameplay, it'd be like a "Real Time Tactical Top-Down Squad-based Strategy" game, a genre-blending mixture of games that is hard to define. It's definitely not competitively multiplayer however this is certainly not a selling point for this game and nor should it. 

If you like WWI and wish there were more games that encompass (in my opinion) the most overlooked era in European history, where you wish a video game existed to get your historical rocks off, this is for you. 

I've had loads of fun playing with my roommate and fellow nerd via the variety of multiplayer network game modes. 

In short, a niche, promising, satisfying and thoroughly enjoyable game that does justice to the as-of-yet-unexplored "World War I" video games. 

If World War I is your thing, Verdun is a FPS take on the era and is also enjoyable (but also not for everyone)

author: {'steamid': '76561198056415712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1469992904}
review:
If you want to just read my original review, scroll down to the bottom.  If you want to know the evolution of my thoughts on this game, read my edits, which have been placed at the top, since they are probably more relevant.  If you want a summary: the game is solid but the marketing is atrocious.

EDIT: 10/24/2015
While I continue to stand by my original rating of the game, as it has solid gameplay and is all around excellent missions, I have to edit my statement on the DLC policy of the developers.  When I had talked of the DLC problem in August, the total cost of the game with all DLC put together was about $40.  Today, the total cost of DLC is over $70.  Although you can still get the whole game by dropping $30 on the Complete Single Player campaign and add the DLC Season Pass for another $15, for a cost of $45 total.  That being said, I would not be surprised if coming down the pipe is another set of DLC that will cost another $15 for a limited set of content.  I am incerasingly worried that the developers are following the Payday 2 development model.  Despite their best efforts to market the game as poorly and arogantly as possible, they have built a rather nice game which I hope survives their best efforts to destroy it.

EDIT: 8/5/2015
As many of you noticed, the company is trying to milk all that is worth out of this game by excessive DLC.  While this is clearly an attempt to rip you off, it is not nearly as bad as you think.  The DLC is only single player campaigns and does not affect multiplayer.  Given that the purpose should not be the single player, you can get away with purchasing the base game and enjoy the multiplayer.  All you lose out on are some glitchy single player missions.  (To be fair, I thought the voice acting and mission scripting was much better than original MoW and I am very much annoyed that as an Alpha buyer I was not given my money's worth for having dropped $15 on the game. That being said, I stand behind my original review of this game.  Terrible sales techniques do not change the solid gameplay.)

Original Review:  From Early Access stage

Sure it is basically Men of War set in the First World War, but it is so much better.  It is asthetically improved and the voice acting is comparatively excellent.  Gameplay is a mix of small unit tactics and massive frontal charges where everyone dies, so you don't have to constantly be bothered by traditional MoW micro management.  Historically accurate references abound throughout the missions and the attention to detail makes this a must for anyone who appreciates the history of the war.  The journal entries give meaning to the campaign missions, so you can enjoy the cast of characters that appear through the missions.  The complexity of the missions really gives the player a sense of how much effort the dev team put into the game.  The player is also made aware of how much this dev team cares about their game.

So in short, its like Men of War but a heck of a lot better because it has a story, it has a dedicated dev team who cares about the quality of the product, and its the First World War.

You want to talk about multiplayer? Stop asking questions and just charge the machine guns already!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198053861357', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1424110075}
review:
Uno de los pocos juegos de estrategia dedicados a la 1¬∫ Guerra Mundial, y sin duda, el mejor de todos ellos. Juego todavia en Alpha, al que sin embargo de momento no le he encontrado ningun bug. Se nota la falta de musica, pero por otro lado esto lo hace mas realista, por lo que realmente no creo que sea un gran problema. El tema grafico es normalito, similar a los que estamos acostumbrados con los primeros Company of heroes, incluso con sus formas de clickear en las areas para que los soldados se cubran.

El juego se basa en un modelo de atacar y defender, basicamente lo que fue la primera guerra mundial, unos protegian sus trincheras mientras el bando contrario intentaba avanzar, y luego al contrario, esto permite un modo de juego muy interesante en cuanto a la estrategia para ir avanzando, permitiendo que en las campa√±as jueguen dos jugadores juntos en mismos bandos, algo que siempre habia echado en falta.

Cabe mencionar que las balas de cada soldado se gastan y habra que ir recogiendo de otros soldados que tengan de sobra o de aquellos que mueran o mates, ademas de poder coger botiquines, morfina, e incluso alguna cosa de indumentaria. Cuentas con varias opciones para agachar y tumbar los soldados, los tipos de movimientos, e incluso si quieres solo que respondan si reciben fuego, que disparen en cuanto vean a un enemigo, o que solo disparen cuando tu lo indiques.

En definitiva, creo que es un juego con mucho potencial, y que si siguen mejorandolo puede ser un gran referente en la estrategia, ya que considero que hace mucho tiempo que no encontraba un juego que dependa de verdad de la estrategia y habilidad de un jugador, dando pie a que puedas manejar un solo soldado para hacer algo especial sin que te vean, o por pelotones, y ademas, tiene un muy buen precio al que no solemos estar acostumbrados en los juegos de estrategia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989169270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1529504052}
review:
TL;DR
Men of War, but World War One RTS.
9/10

The campaign plays brilliantly like the original MoW..
It provides differeniating scenarios in which you may attack, defend, use stealth or a mixture of all of them to complete your objectives. The multiplayer is currently limited to Front Lines and Co-Op however I believe there are plans to roll out additional game modes (Such as Domination and TDM). 

The graphics are fine, and the weaponry and uniforms are fitting to the era. You may play as the British, French, Germans or Russians, and play against eachother online in any combination. Furthermore, the game now focuses on strategy on a larger scale as opposed to the traditional MoW games. Micro-management can still be the decider of battles online and on singleplayer and can be the difference between a crushing defeat or a stunning victory.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981491448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1480614116}
review:
Early Access Review:

After noticing this the day of release I was grabbed from the start. 
WW1 RTS? Actual use of trenches?! (Unheard of in most WW1 games, besides Verdun also check that out too!) TANKS?
So far this game has everything that a WW1 RTS needs. Besides the community, which is steadily growing since release, (say 12 full games last evening), glad to also see the devs responding on discussions and also having a planned roadmap (unlike most early access reviews).

Pros:
Traditional Men of War gamestyle, "If it aint broke dont fix it" is applied very well here. The engine is well built so no major bugs or game breaking glitches found since the engine has been out for a while.
Well detail maps and models, From the rivets on the tanks to the boards in the trenches the game is very well detailed to keep you immersed in the WW1 world. Though I can tell there will be graphical updates in the future.
Still tactical multiplayer, Most of WW1 was mass-infantry charges right after artillery barrages. Which isnt much of a tactic. But with the Men of War engine you have to probe your enemies trenches for weakspots, find out where their arty is before yours (arty is god in WW1), Then when you actually get men into the trenches you have to worry about moving your soldiers through them without getting shot (as much). But still hold true to the WW1 mechanics (still see those glorious infantry charges, and artillery barrages, without losing most of your forces)


Cons:
Lag, still tends to "come up" with a player who tends to have a computer that says "no", first two games were dropped since the client was lost. But that only happened with people 2000+ miles from me (-5 GMT)
First mission is a bloodbath, almost instantly your men get off the train theres a hailfire of artillery and gunfire coming towards your men, prepare your anus.
Editor would be nice! (I can see its coming though so no rush there)
More maps! Maybe add steam workshop support? Community Maps? Potential is great here. 


Other than that the game is great and I reccomend any WW1/RTS buff and all friends to get this!
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198016932397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1485940809}
review:
This game has a brilliant feel to it I'm only 3 missions in and I'm already in love with this game. Gameplay feels like men of war however they do a great with it and make it fit ww1 perfectly. 10/10 few bugs but it early access what do you expect.
Now the Multiplyer is a whole different story I think my mutiplayer experience so far has had me drooling  the gamemode front lines is probably the best mutiplayer game mode possible. Nothing like it I always wished that when I played men of war that there would be a game mode like campaign missions but mutiplayer and both sides have to ability to call in reinforcements its like playing a campaign mission but with inteligent enemys. The premis is simple you either start with attacking or defending while the defender has to prepair defences the attacker has to prepair his attack force then the game starts and you have to invade or defend. The map is massive also and therefore the defenders have an abundance of defences to fall back apon. This was absolutly brilliant theres nothing like seeing a horde of English soldiers storm a dug in German defence. 

 would therefore definatly reccomend that you buy this game it is well worth the money if you are into stratagy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030461836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 8792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1500620173}
review:
[h1]-Recommended Title-[/h1]

I have followed BoE since it first appeared on Greenlight, and have been eager to get my hands on a copy. Well, my eagerness has not been dulled since purchasing and playing this early access ww1 game.

The gameplay is the typical MoW style, with objectives to be completed in order to progress. The  models and overall graphics are well suited to the era - and should look quite amazing with the rtm version. No performance issues running on a Windows 8.1 laptop (..mine has 4GBRAM /500GB HDD/Intel HD &Radeon 3670m 2GB (Hybrid) graphics with the settings all maxxed out). 

There are many types of units and equipment included in the "ea" release. So far I've played with the Infantry, Artillery, Mounted rifles, a British tank (and yes, they make excellent target practice for the Germans), support troops (ran a telephone line! ...and threw smoke to call in arty). All seems to be well represented and functional.

Missions and factions are limited right now, but more content will be added over time.

There is a passable tutorial, which is good enough to get you started - and a fairly challenging but enjoyable first mission. There are 8 missions, I think, in the current campaign.

The ambient sounds are good, although the gun fire does sound a bit "wrong". The voice overs are definately wrong - but funny at the same time. I feel I'm in command of a rag tag company :P

There are ingame options to select, although I could not get the music to go lower than the tutorial captains voice - so he was hard to hear.

Overall, straight off the digital shelf - this is an awesome effort by the developers  in bringing a ww1 rts to life. It's definately worth adding to the list.. and if you are wondering, it's similar to the CoH mod: The Great War 1918, and of course if you own CoH and/or the Men of War series you know what to expect gameplay and graphics wise.
No crashes or glitches have been encountered - after 1.4 hours of gameplay.

 [i]  Review Update 3.5 hrs playtime:[/i] Having played around 3.5 hours now - I have had one crash, after playing a MP match and was in the lobby chatting away. ALT+TAB'd out and when I went to ALT+TAB back in, the game threw an exception. Not a show stopper tho. Just relaunched the game. 

[i] Review Update 6.4 hrs playtime:[/i] Had a few 2v1/2v2/3v3 multiplayer matches - and all I can say is "wow" . The mp is epic! And very true to the murderous "advance with rifle" ww1, strategies.

It has to be played to be experienced... 

[i]Review Update 13.4 hrs playtime:[/i] Having alot of fun in the single player campaign - I have progressed to the 3rd mission (Night before the offensive). It's a stealth mission which brings in quite an interesting element to the game. I've been playing mostly multiplayer - and really enjoying it. I do struggle with the limited squad selection ability, but it does mean a bit more micromanagement - hopefully this gets improved and greater troop numbers are made available to the player. 3v3 is still epic tho!


"The tides may turn, only after many souls have fallen."



[b]Early Access Score: 8.5/10[/b]

review: Not as shiny as Men of War Assault Squad 2, as it is based on Men of War engine without DMS graphic changes, but looks and plays nice. The best thing is that it's about World War I and it runs nice. As it is Early Access I'm sure in full release there will be even much more fun!
